story:
HELLO GALAXY LIFESTYLE YOGIS

Nadiah and Tracy are twin sisters knocking out the challenge of helping others in their fitness adventure. Tracy has been teaching Aerial Yoga for years and would like to bring an Aerial Yoga studio to her fellow clients like you.

The studio would house many different teachers of specialty skills like Acro Yoga, PreNatal Yoga, Yin Yoga, CardiYo sculpt, Hot Mama & Baby yoga and many more

We have a fundamental mission to offer classes and events at a fair market rate while paying our instructors and staff a good living wage. In addition to our Aerial classes, regular classes and specialty, we offer donation classes and work/trade to help make our classes available to students from all walks of life. We feel a studio should reflect its local community and we want Galaxy Lifestyle to appeal to people from a wide range of ages, backgrounds, and interests.

 

We need your help to make this a reality for your health and creative benefits.

 

Would you like to Join Us

It will give us the budget to:

  • Construct & Design: Stable Structure for Aerial Yoga, Mirrors, Sound System, Lighting  
  • Equipment: Silk Hammock and kit
  • Business Insurance 
  • Office Supplies/Computer/print
  • Membership system for 1 month
  • Marketing
  • Fitness Equipment
  • Professional Fees such as Website Developer
  • Permits/Licenses

 

“Galaxy Lifestyle means to us, Millions of stars (our FRIENDS) gravitational attracted to one another for a healthier lifestyle.”

story:
Short Summary

Thank you for your interest in Just Been Tested, also known as JBT Foundation, Inc.(JBT). 

We believe the current approach to STD testing is outdated, as far too many people are left crippled in fear of the perceived stigma surrounding the testing experience.  

Just Been Tested shatters that mindset and enables you to celebrate and get rewarded for your decision to get tested.

                                       


The Problem 

  • According to the CDC, 9.5 million new sexually transmitted disease cases affect those aged 15-24 annually. 
  • By age 25, one of two sexually active persons will acquire a sexually transmitted disease.                                            

                                      


Our Mission

JBT helps reduce the spread of sexually transmitted diseases (specifically HIV) by popularizing the practice of getting tested. 

We provide free testing opportunities and integrate these events within the everyday lives of young people - where they live, where they study, where they play and where they socialize. 

We have already been able to achieve significant results by building a sustainable network of retail sponsors, peer-to-peer ambassadors, health professionals, and more.


What does JBT do? 

One of the ways JBT combats the spread of HIV is by hosting fun and meaningful social events at academic institutions across the country. Young people receive free information, HIV screenings and contraception. We support entertainment events, including concerts, sporting events, community drives, and more.

          

                                       (Game Night testing event on campus)

Through our online social media platform (JustBeenTested.com), members can talk about dating, sexual health and more. But they can also choose to share their latest vacation photos while sharing the latest music gossip, fashion or sports news. Whatever they decide, it's all at their fingertips and in a safe, nonjudgmental environment. 

JBT members can also seek private or public answers to any questions regarding sexual and reproductive health from some of our online certified health experts.

    


Accomplishments

  • JBT has completed more than 10 testing events since June 2013, reaching hundreds of students and young adults.
  • We test an average of 25-40 people at each event. Most testing agencies average 80-120 people tested a week. 
  • We have more than 10 JBT Campus Ambassadors across the North East.
  • We have more than 200 verified members apart of our online network.
  • We have two volunteers on staff with Masters in Public Health degrees who serve as resources for confidential online sexual health questions submitted by users.
  • We provide links to care and counseling for individuals who test positive for an STD.

                           

JBT'S Advantage

Our new incentive model allows us to partner with everyday retailers to provide exclusive discounts and services to individuals tested by JBT. 

In the mood for pizza? Need a new outfit for the weekend? Want to exercise? Want to catch a movie? JBT members can experience any of the above and more at a special discount, just for knowing their status.

We already have several commitments from restaurants, boutiques, electronic stores, tattoo shops, food trucks and fitness centers. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help in raising $35,000, which would not only cover the cost of our first JBT-owned mobile testing unit for a year, but also the creation of our mobile app. 

With these two important tools, we can reach more people, provide more free screenings and continue to make it easier for individuals to know their status.

We partner with popular brands to incentivize people with cool rewards to get tested at our events.  These same brands support our initiative and want to us to have a successful crowd funding campaign:

           

       


The Goal

Over the next 12 months, JBT's goal is to successfully screen 4,000 individuals and conduct a comprehensive college tour (New York, New Jersey, Connecticut, Pennsylvania and Massachusetts). 

Many young adults are more comfortable getting tested through JBT for a variety of reasons, some including: their student insurance does not cover HIV screenings and out-of-pocket costs are too expensive. 

                           


JBT's Challenge 

Unfortunately, due to the lack of funds at our disposal, we have been forced to deny a variety of incoming requests from schools who are in need of having our presence on their campuses. 
We are solely dependent on mobile testing units that are owned by third party organizations. As such, we continually face challenges outside of our control, including last minute cancellations and equipment failures with some mobile units. Ultimately this affects JBT's ability to serve the community.
With your generous donation, we can secure our first JBT-owned mobile testing unit and make sure we reach every school in need, recruit more campus ambassadors and make a lasting difference.
Together, we can change lives.

    


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word of our campaign through your personal network.  Follow us on Instagram @justbeentested and Facebook for updates about our upcoming events and partnerships.

story:
Aloha! My name is Ahlia Hoffman from Cardiff By The Sea in San Diego California. Im so excited that my tandem surf partner and I just recently qualified to compete in the Pro tandem surfing competition in Hawaii. The competition is called 
Duke’s Ocean Festival August 19-23, 2014 Waikiki Oahu Hawaii.  See our tandem surf video here http://vimeo.com/103039763

My tandem partner and I have competed in contests up and down the West Coast and around the world.  Through such travel to local and international competitions with the accompanying media coverage, we will help you sell your product.  Because of the unique aspects of our sport, we can augment your visibility in the surfing world through product sponsorship.  We are looking forward to surfing and competing more both locally and around the world.

UPDATE:
Aloha! It's not too late to donate!  Please help my campaign :)  We are going to Australia in March to  compete in tandem surfing at the Noosa Surf Festival. I would be thrilled to be supported by you and your company, please feel free to send gear as I'm more than happy to wear/represent around town and at future Tandem Surf Competitions.  Mahalo!!

Recent Results:

5th Place at Duke's Ocean Festival
August 21st, 2014 Waikiki Hawaii

1st Place Oceanside Long Board Surf Club
August 2nd, 2014 Oceanside California

3rd Place Malibu Call to the Wall 
July 19th, 2014 Malibu California

Personal Best:

Noosa Festival of Surfing (Pro) 3rd Place
2006 Noosa Heads, Queensland Australia

ITSA Tandem Surfing World Championship (Pro) 9th Place
2006 Waikiki Beach, Oahu Hawaii

Surf-n-Co Coupe du Monde (Pro) 4th Place

2007 Hossegor/Seignosse, France

1st Place Oceanside Long Board Surf Club

2014 Oceanside, California

Tandem surfing is a graceful and beautiful sport, combining physical agility with strength and elegance.  Tandem surfing is an amazing and dramatic spectacle.  When we are out in the water, we always attract an audience on the shore, as well as in the line-up.  Onlookers are curious about our equipment, the lifts and poses, and the feeling of flying above the waves.  We compete in professional competitions, charity competitions and surfing exhibitions worldwide. 

Mahalo for your generosity and support!!!

-Ahlia

story:
The RESPOT project is the new view to the world of tracking devices. We have tried to look at the problem of losing stuff from the different side. Why you have to track lost things, if you can never forget them! That’s why we developed the first smallest and easiest REMINDING device.

RESPOT is a tiny gadget that protects you from losing stuff. It’s your personal reminding device. With The RESPOT you will NEVER FORGET your important stuff again. After attaching RESPOT to all your important things such as your wallet, keys, laptop or pets and whatever, and pairing it with the RESPOT application, you can always feel secure that everything is where it should be - with you.



Using RESPOT is extremely easy. Simply stick it to anything you don't want to lose and install the RESPOT app on your smartphone. If the distance between your smartphone and RESPOT exceeds the number you define according to your needs (60 meters maximum), the phone will alert you and you can use it to look for the RESPOT item: press one of two buttons in the smartphone app and your RESPOT starts flashing or squeaking.









The RESPOT application is very easy to use. Attach The RESPOT to your concrete item, pair it with your smartphone application. At the interface it will be available for you adding a specific item, renaming, setting a range of action, notification settings (sound and lights allert) and other additional functions. If the distance between you and your RESPOT exceeds the distance you define according to your settings in the app, your phone will alert you.           
              







We made a lot of discoveries during the creation of our product, passed many trials and difficult decisions and now, when all the important steps are made, one remained. The final step to bring this project to life is your support. With your help, we can launch a mass production and make your life easier. We hope you will join us and The RESPOT will be a part of your everyday life.




The RESPOT project is the new view to the world of tracking devices. Why to track lost things, when you can never forget them in the first place! The RESPOT is the smallest reminding gadget of its kind in the world. Just 17 mm wide and 2.5 mm tall, but still it’s durable, shock resistant, waterproof and has a rechargeable battery that lasts over 2 months. With RESPOT you will forget about the words „search“ or „lose“ and your items will be always with you. All your important things such as your wallet, keys, laptop, tablet, pets or even kids are now secured with RESPOT. 






We already have a working prototypes of The RESPOT. Our last steps, that remained are the improvement of smartphone application for iOS and Android, testing of final product, certification process and mass production. In case of a successful campaign, we guarantee a high quality service, delivering goods in time and enjoy of using the product.






How does The RESPOT work?

The RESPOT connects to your smartphone via Bluetooth Low Energy 4.0 connection.

How to use The RESPOT?

Simply stick it to anything you don't want to forget and install the RESPOT app on your smartphone.

How to use The RESPOT application?

Pair your RESPOT with your smartphone application via Bluetooth connection. Add a specific item, rename it, set a range of action, notification settings (sound and lights allert) and other additional functions.

What is the range of action of The RESPOT?

The maximum distance you can set is 60 meters.

How I have to set the distance range of my RESPOT?

Depending on the importance of the item you stick the RESPOT to, you can define the distance according to your needs. For example, if you stick RESPOT to your wallet, set 1-3 meters distance, and when you exceed the number you define, the phone will alert you. You will NEVER FORGET your wallet again. Or stick it on your dog, set 50 meters distance range, thus your dog will be at accessible distance.

What kind of battery does The RESPOT use?

ML614 Rechargeable Lithium Coin Battery.

How long does The RESPOT battery last?

2 months.

Is battery rechargeable?

Yes! The RESPOT uses rechargeable coin battery, and after 2 months of using, you can easily recharge your RESPOT.

How to recharge my RESPOT’s battery?

Your package will include 1 USB battery charger. Recharge your battery by plugging your charger in any USB connector.

Is The RESPOT waterproof?

Yes, it is.

What if I lose my phone?

In case you lose your phone, just press the button on RESPOT and your smartphone will start ringing and vibrating, so you can easily find your phone.

Which mobile platforms are compatible with RESPOT mobile application?

RESPOT app will be available on iOS and Android.

When will early bird order arrive?

Estimated shipping dates of first RESPOT devices is April 2016. We will work very hard to deliver your RESPOT as soon as possible.




Well, at the very end...

Feel free to contact us if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

Email: office@the-respot.com

Don't forget to like and follow us on social networks!
Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter

For questions regarding distribution, partnership and cooperation please email us at: sidorenko@the-respot.com

story:
What is golftripsNOW


golftripsNOW is a young, dynamic company that has created a website designed to revolutionize the way you book your golf vacation. It is the first 100% online golf travel website that allows you to build your golf package in just a few simple steps. Using next-gen technology we provide you with tee-time and hotel prices and availability in real time. This means no more waiting to receive quotes from golf travel companies or visiting separate websites to book your hotel and tee times . Your time is priceless and we want you to use it wisely. Now you can go to one website to plan your whole golf trip by choosing your dates, courses, tee times and hotel, all live in real time. golftripsNOW then enables you to share the trip that you have created with your golf buddies and pay without ever speaking to anyone so that you can book a golf vacation the same way that you have been booking your vacations on "other" websites - the future of golf travel has NOW arrived. 

Take a look at our website!


Features


Here at golftripsNOW, our team has developed a revolutionary reservation platform for golfers to create and book their golf trips on one website and in one transaction.

Choose your destination and the travel dates for the trip:


Filter your results and see where the courses are using our interactive map:


Find the tee-times that fit your dates and budget, and choose from the list of suggested must play courses for the trip:


We're user friendly!:


Find your ideal hotel for the trip in relation to the golf courses you picked for the group:

 And then share your trip with your friends:


With your help we can:

  • Develop cutting-edge group software for the website, so that planning your vacation will become even simpler! It will allow each player to enter a group chat with the other members of the group, modify their own itinerary and crucially pay individually. 

  • Integrate with more tee time operators and hotel providers to expand our inventory even further. 

  • Introduce a fully functional app for all iOS and Android platforms so that you can book your golf holiday on the go! 

    This is why we need you! To help us automate the golf industry and bring it into the 21st century. So, join us on this revolutionary journey to bring about the change to the world of golf that is desperately needed.



    How golftripsNOW came about

    It all started with golfboo.com, the extremely successful golf travel comparison website for the European marketplace. We have worked with many golf travel companies over the years and while watching the trends in the US we felt that something key was missing. So, we partnered with a US based team to develop the ultimate travel website for golfers and simplify the process of planning and booking their golf trips to Orlando, Myrtle Beach, Miami, Scottsdale, Vegas and many more.

    The non-existence of a golf travel website that provides a complete and time saving solution for the golfer led us to develop this new and exciting concept. With over 40 years combined experience between the Executive Team at golftripsNOW we looked at the facts and have been determined to come up with a solution for you. And, what a solution we have!

    We designed golftripsNOW as a 100% online golf travel solution to automate the planning and booking process. Booking golf vacations has never been so easy, and NOW we are here to change the way you book your golf trip forever!



    Timeline






    • The Team



    Fabio - Co-Founder of golftripsNOW
    Antonio - Co-Founder of golftripsNOW
    Ty - Co-Founder of golftripsNOW
    Rosa - European operations
    Antonio - Web designer/programmer
    Francisco - Web designer/programmer
    Henry - Head of marketing
    Anu - Online management



    Rewards


    golftripsNOW needs the resources to enter the market strongly as well as investing in pioneering software development. We came to Indiegogo to ask for your support. Your pledges will put golftripsNOW on the map and so we want to give you something in return!

    $5 - A huge thanks from the team!


    $25 - golftripsNOW Gift Pack 1


    $50 - golftripsNOW Gift Pack 2

    $100 - golftripsNOW Gift Pack 3



    $250 - golftripsNOW 10% 1 year discount





    $500 - golftripsNOW 20% 2 year discount




    $1000 - golftripsNOW 20% Lifetime discount




    $950 - golftripsNOW Orlando vacation




    $1200 - golftripsNOW Vegas vacation





    Risks & Challenges

    The satisfaction of our customers is a core value here at golftripsNOW so we want to keep you all up to date with our progress. 

    As a new young company in the technology sector, we may encounter some hurdles along the way. We will ensure that you are kept up to date with any delays or problems that we come across so that you are not left in the dark. 

    We will try to fix any issue that we encounter as efficiently as possible so that your experience with golftripsNOW is how it should be.

    Do not hesitate to ask us any questions and we will respond a soon as possible.

    https://golftripsnow.com

    So please join us on this journey, and help bring golf travel into the 21st Century!
story_txt:
What is golftripsNOW

golftripsNOW is a young, dynamic company that has created a website designed to revolutionize the way you book your golf vacation. It is the first 100% online golf travel website that allows you to build your golf package in just a few simple steps. Using next-gen technology we provide you with tee-time and hotel prices and availability in real time. This means no more waiting to receive quotes from golf travel companies or visiting separate websites to book your hotel and tee times . Your time is priceless and we want you to use it wisely. Now you can go to one website to plan your whole golf trip by choosing your dates, courses, tee times and hotel, all live in real time. golftripsNOW then enables you to share the trip that you have created with your golf buddies and pay without ever speaking to anyone so that you can book a golf vacation the same way that you have been booking your vacations on "other" websites - the future of golf travel has NOW arrived. Take a look at our website!





Features
Here at golftripsNOW, our team has developed a revolutionary reservation platform for golfers to create and book their golf trips on one website and in one transaction.Choose your destination and the travel dates for the trip:
Filter your results and see where the courses are using our interactive map:
Find the tee-times that fit your dates and budget, and choose from the list of suggested must play courses for the trip:

We're user friendly!:

Find your ideal hotel for the trip in relation to the golf courses you picked for the group: And then share your trip with your friends:


With your help we can:


Develop cutting-edge group software for the website, so that planning your vacation will become even simpler! It will allow each player to enter a group chat with the other members of the group, modify their own itinerary and crucially pay individually. 
Integrate with more tee time operators and hotel providers to expand our inventory even further. 

Introduce a fully functional app for all iOS and Android platforms so that you can book your golf holiday on the go! This is why we need you! To help us automate the golf industry and bring it into the 21st century. So, join us on this revolutionary journey to bring about the change to the world of golf that is desperately needed.

How golftripsNOW came about

It all started with golfboo.com, the extremely successful golf travel comparison website for the European marketplace. We have worked with many golf travel companies over the years and while watching the trends in the US we felt that something key was missing. So, we partnered with a US based team to develop the ultimate travel website for golfers and simplify the process of planning and booking their golf trips to Orlando, Myrtle Beach, Miami, Scottsdale, Vegas and many more.
The non-existence of a golf travel website that provides a complete and time saving solution for the golfer led us to develop this new and exciting concept. With over 40 years combined experience between the Executive Team at golftripsNOW we looked at the facts and have been determined to come up with a solution for you. And, what a solution we have!
We designed golftripsNOW as a 100% online golf travel solution to automate the planning and booking process. Booking golf vacations has never been so easy, and NOW we are here to change the way you book your golf trip forever!

Timeline









The Team
Fabio - Co-Founder of golftripsNOWAntonio - Co-Founder of golftripsNOWTy - Co-Founder of golftripsNOWRosa - European operationsAntonio - Web designer/programmerFrancisco - Web designer/programmerHenry - Head of marketingAnu - Online management

Rewards
golftripsNOW needs the resources to enter the market strongly as well as investing in pioneering software development. We came to Indiegogo to ask for your support. Your pledges will put golftripsNOW on the map and so we want to give you something in return!
$5 - A huge thanks from the team!

$25 - golftripsNOW Gift Pack 1

$50 - golftripsNOW Gift Pack 2

$100 - golftripsNOW Gift Pack 3






$250 - golftripsNOW 10% 1 year discount







$500 - golftripsNOW 20% 2 year discount






$1000 - golftripsNOW 20% Lifetime discount









$950 - golftripsNOW Orlando vacation


$1200 - golftripsNOW Vegas vacation







Risks & Challenges  
The satisfaction of our customers is a core value here at golftripsNOW so we want to keep you all up to date with our progress. 
As a new young company in the technology sector, we may encounter some hurdles along the way. We will ensure that you are kept up to date with any delays or problems that we come across so that you are not left in the dark. 
We will try to fix any issue that we encounter as efficiently as possible so that your experience with golftripsNOW is how it should be.
Do not hesitate to ask us any questions and we will respond a soon as possible.https://golftripsnow.com   

So please join us on this journey, and help bring golf travel into the 21st Century!

story:
January and February of 2008, Dave Klingler had to under go a series of emergency operations on both of his feet because of bone infections.  The operations on Dave's right foot resulted in permanent disability in walking and standing.  Over the past four and a half years, Dave has incurred many medical bills which have drained his savings and added debts for his family. Finally, September of 2011, Dave found a doctor in Boise, Idaho (which is 310 miles and a 5 hour drive from his home) who feels that he can repair Dave's right foot to allow him to walk and stand, but Dave's part of the cost, not covered by his medical insurance, will be $12,000.  This breaks down to $6,000 deductible and $6,000 out of pocket before insurance pays 100%.  Without the surgery, the eventual choices are: absolutely no walking or standing (wheelchair) or amputation.

 Dave has been the Meals on Wheels delivery driver and volunteer coordinator for the Rexburg, Idaho area since January 2006.  During the 6 months of 2008 when Dave was in the hospital and rehabilitation, his family and friends delivered the Meals on Wheels for him.  Even after 6 months, when he was able to have limited walking to return to work, he still had to have a permanent IV line because of an antibiotic resistant infection that he caught in the hospital that took 9 months to over come.  Dave has always done his best to be a good neighbor and to be of service to his community and the world in general (He spent 2 years in Portugal as a service missionary). 

 The funds raised will cover Dave’s cost to repair his right foot from a 95% disability to about a 25% disability.  This will allow Dave to walk and stand and do many activities that he now cannot enjoy.  Any additional funds collected will allow Dave to pay the travel expenses to Boise for the operation and the doctor follow-up visits ($132 in gas expense and $60 for motel each trip) and also to pay debts that he and his family have incurred from his disability (about $30K). Also, Dave's left foot is having some difficulty that needs correction in the future (Another $12K ?). 

 Please note the unique perks that Dave offers for your kind contributions. Dave's wife, Jackie (of 25 years), and his son and daughter wish to thank you for your consideration.   Also, it would be greatly appreciated if you can spread the word in the efforts for him to return to a more normal walking and standing life!  See the Indiegogo share tools to help! Dave’s children say—if nothing else his foot pictures are cool and gross!

story:
"You see things; and you say 'Why?' But I dream of things that never were; and say, 'Why not?'"
George Bernard Shaw 

"Why not... make an impact?"

The world continues to be affected significantly by multiple sclerosis. In Canada alone, 100,000 people live with this disease, and 3 more families learn every day that someone they love now has to cope with MS. In fact, just in my country, 1 in every 2 people knows someone directly affected.

While it is most often diagnosed in young adults, aged 15 to 40, we know that it affects children, some as young as two years old, and women are more than three times as likely to be affected. That impact is felt by family, friends and by the community. MS is unpredictable, affecting vision, hearing, memory, balance and mobility. Its effects are physical, emotional, financial, and last a lifetime. There is no cure...

But MS isn't just Canada's disease. Yes, it's true: we are one of the most affected countries in the world, but you can find the spectre of MS haunting nearly every corner of the globe.

And as much as I wish it were otherwise, one of those next people to be diagnosed... might be you!

"Why not... try to make the best of things?"

When I was first diagnosed with multiple sclerosis over 20 years ago, I felt lost. I always found myself asking "why did this happen to me?"... but no matter how hard I looked, I wasn't finding any answers that made any sense to me. I eventually came to understand that if you can move beyond the "whys" and instead concentrate on the "hows", only then will you find yourself being rewarded for your efforts.

You see, I eventually realized that "karma" occasionally works in reverse; that you will sometimes first find yourself having to sail your way through some pretty challenging waters, before reaching that paradise awaiting you on the other side of your journey.

Learning that type of perseverance has earned me many wonderful blessings, and as seemingly easy as it would have been for me to simply "give up", my doing so would have caused me to miss out on those great rewards.

I think that this point in my life is one such "reward"!

"Why not... try to lead by example?"

I've met some remarkable people over the years, whose strength and determination have served daily to inspire me! These "heroes" thrive in the face of adversity, and they have made it their mission to help others affected by multiple sclerosis to lead amazing lives of their own... and to one day be free from MS!

I am proud to say that I am now following their example as an ambassador and spokesperson, myself, for the Multiple Sclerosis Society of Canada. This way, I can give back to others the way this incredible organization has given of itself to me. I've gained a lot, too: I've learned the true definitions of both courage and fortitude, and what it really means to be a victor over your life, and not merely a victim of it!

Now I want to stay in this good place, but to do that, I have to keep earning my right to be here! So... I'm giving back! I'm paying it forward, and in the only way I know how: uniquely mine! Thanks to a truly amazing life, and an incredible once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, I now find myself with this unique chance: to honour all those people who came before; who have lead via their incredible examples... by setting an example of my own! 

"Why not... try and tame Everest?"

The expression "go big or go home" is one that resonates deeply within me!

A few years back I found myself being presented with this unique possibility: try tackling one of the toughest physical challenges anyone on planet Earth can face, regardless of any limitations they may possess.

I had never before dreamt of a chance like this coming into my life, but, like the good fortune that had been guiding me to that point, I trusted immediately what the opportunity represented: the means to "lead by example", by helping to tear down the walls standing between the physically challenged and our wildest dreams. So... here I am!

Basically, using a specially designed wheelchair created specifically for the purpose of navigating rugged mountain terrain, I will be travelling with my team from Lhasa in Tibet, Asia, to Everest Base Camp... an over 12,000 ft. climb! 

I will be leaving in the fall of 2014 and the entire trip will last a little over 3 weeks. I have even been working to secure a cameraman to accompany up to that wilderness in the sky, to be filming this voyage for posterity, and hopefully sharing with the world my own example of what it means to face adversity... and win!

Still, as brave and as worthy as all this may sound, the fact is... I simply can't do it alone. I need your help! More than that, I really want to bring a part of each and every one of you up that mountain with me!

Here's how that can happen...

"Why not... make a contribution yourself?"

Okay, Here's the deal folks:

I'm using this whole experience as an opportunity to try and raise a whopping $100,000 to help end MS!

By donating to this cause, you're not only helping to find a cause and cure for multiple sclerosis, but you're also helping me and my team to secure part of the funding needed to pay for our equipment, including that special wheelchair I mentioned, plus part of our travel expenses.

But here's the best reason of all to give: of that huge goal I envision, over 75% of that money is being allocated to the MS Society of Canada, helping it to succeed in its mission: to be a leader in finding a cure for multiple sclerosis, and enabling people affected by MS to enhance their quality of life!

That's on TOP of the nearly $20,000 I've already successfully raised to date--pure fundraising dollars that go directly towards assisting those coping with multiple sclerosis to live better lives! 

And since I'm also a really big fan of the win/win philosophy, I'm making this worth your while, too! So... here's some of what YOU will be getting for your invaluable contribution:

  • MultipleMike Climbs branded clothing, including shirts, hats and even shoe laces
  • MS Bands of Hope for you to proudly wear and show off
  • Printed greeting cards of paintings by the late Kathy Harvey, an award-winning and inspirational quadriplegic mouth painter who lived with MS.

"Why not!"

Sometimes it's hard to believe that you--yes, YOU--have within you the ability to make a difference in the lives of others, especially people whom you've never even met. But with every donation made, you will make a difference... I promise you!

And even if you can't give at this time, you can still pass on this website address to family or friends, neighbours and coworkers... anyone, really, who likes the thought of making the world a better place!

See, one day you might have the chance to ask your children or grandchildren: "Do you know what MS is?" And when they say they've never heard if it, you'll be able to look them proudly in the eye and say without any hesitation: "That's because of me!"

And by giving today, you're doing more than simply owning a part of that cure... you'll be owning a part of history!

So, it all comes down to a true team effort, and I'm hoping you will join MY team so that, together, we can once and for all... finally... end MS!

CHEERS!

Mike "Augy" Augustine
MS Spokesperson and Ambassador

story:
• Our daughter Margaret, age 14  has a rare autoimmune disorder called Pediatric Autoimmune neurological disorder Associated with Strep. When she is exposed to a viral or bacteria illness her antibodies cross her blood brain barrier and attack her brain causing inflamation and a miriad of symptoms. She developed this illness at age 6 from a strep infection and was misdiagnosed for several years because it is such a rare and newly recognized illness.  Some of the symptoms that are the result of the inflamation are OCD, nerological tics, anxiety, and reading and writing difficulties. Since finally getting a diagnosis three years ago, symptoms have been somewhat manageable on antibiotics and steroids, however these treatments are just bandaids for her symptoms. What she desperatly needs are more aggressive treatments to halt the autoimmune preocess such  asIVIG and plasma exchange which areextremely costly and cosnsidered experimental because they are in the trial stages at Yale Childrens Research Institute. These treatments cost approximately $10,000 per treatment and she may need several.

     Margaret has suffered greatly, missing out on most of her childhood and a great deal of her schooling has been affected. We are determined to get her 100% healthy so she can live a symptom free life. Your contributions will greatly help Margaret receive the medically necessary treatment so she can live free from this devastating illness. A  life she so deserves. The funds will also help cover the traveling cost because there are only a few doctors in the country who perform these treatments for this particular illness.

    Margaret is a true hero, although she has been through more than most ever will in their lifetime she wakes up everyday with a smile on her face and with determination to make the most of her day. Her comical ,quirky sense of humor and kind personality is such a joy to those who know her.

      We are so grateful and aprreciate your support !

    Thank you.

            Brett and Thomas Henry

story:
Our Story

When we adopted our first son Charlie, we expected him to die.  He has a severe form of Recessive
Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa.  This disease occurs because of a missing protein that binds the two layers of skin together.  The slightest bump or rub will cause skin to blister and fall off revealing wounds similar to 2nd and 3rd degree burns.  Even the inside of the body is affected.  Children endure extreme pain daily.  Dressing changes and baths take up to 5 hours.  Eyeballs can blister causing painful corneal erosions and days spent in the dark.  Hands and feet fuse making mitten deformities.  Blisters in the throat cause strictures making it almost impossible to eat and possibly cutting off the airway.  If a person does not succumb to infection...a severe form of Squamous Cell Carcinoma will develop and take the life.  When I heard of a clinical trial in Minnesota using stem cells to treat Epidermolysis Bullosa we met with doctors.  A perfect donor match was found and Charlie was accepted.  Then Wisconsin Medicaid denied this life saving treatment.  I contacted State Representatives, Congress, Media, and the community and we rallied for Charlie's cause.  Medicaid rescinded it decision and now because of Charlie, Medicaid is changing how they authorize life saving treatments for rare diseases.  One year ago today, Charlie had a Stem Cell Transplant.  He is one of the first children in the world with this disease that have ever seen such incredible results.  No longer does skin fall off, we use 1/100th of the dressings that we used before, and he can enjoy life with out pain like a regular 5 year old boy should.


  http://wearegreenbay.com/search-fulltext?nxd_id...


Now, we have been given the opportunity to once again save the life of a child.  We are adopting a little boy with severe EB who has never had a family.   He currently lives in a group home and has never had a "constant" person that he could depend on.  We do not believe that this is an acceptable way to live.  I am going to meet him in 3 weeks and I am flying him back to our home at the end of March.  This is the problem.  Seth does not have a bedroom or a medical/dressing room for baths and dressing changes.  We need to make our house wheelchair accessible to have him live with us and become our son.

http://www.postcrescent.com/article/20111231/AP...



The Impact

This little boy will have a bedroom not a "hospital room."


What We Need & What You Get

We need to build an addition to the first floor of our house that will include a bedroom, a specialized bathroom with a height adjustable bathtub, and a place for dressing changes.  We are saving our own money, some local community friends have had bakesales ect to help raise money, but we know that we need more help.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with as many people you know.  You can also visit my journal for any information on our family.  I have kept this journal for the past year and have posted all the details of Charlie's transplant.  http://www.caringbridge.org/visit/charletonknuth or you can simply google Charlie Knuth and you will find millions of sites and news footage of our family.  It takes a village to raise a child.  I will love them, advocate, give them a home and a family, and be the nurse, but I still need a little more help.  Thank you.

 disease that have ever seen such incredible results.  No longer 
does skin fall off, we use 1/100th of the dressings that we used before,
 and he can enjoy life with out pain like a regular 5 year old boy 
should.

  http://wearegreenbay.com/search-fulltext?nxd_id...

Now, we have been given the 
opportunity to once again save the life of a child.  We are 
adopting a little boy with severe EB who has never had a family.   He currently lives in a group home and 
has never had a "constant" person that he could depend on.  We do 
not believe that this is an acceptable way to live.  I am going to 
meet him in 3 weeks and I am flying him back to our home at the end of 
March.  This is the problem.  Seth does not have a bedroom or a
 medical/dressing room for baths and dressing changes.  We need to 
make our house wheelchair accessible to have him live with us and become
 our son. 
 http://www.postcrescent.com/article/20111231/AP...




The Impact
This little boy will have a bedroom not a "hospital room."



What We Need & What You Get
We
 need to build an addition to the first floor of our house that will 
include a bedroom, a specialized bathroom with a height adjustable 
bathtub, and a place for dressing changes.  We are saving our own 
money, some local community friends have had bakesales ect to help raise
 money, but we know that we need more help.



Other Ways You Can Help
Please
 share with as many people you know.  You can also visit my journal
 for any information on our family.  I have kept this journal for 
the past year and have posted all the details of Charlie's 
transplant.  http://www.caringbridge.org/visit/charletonknuth or 
you can simply google Charlie Knuth and you will find millions of sites 
and news footage of our family.  It takes a village to raise a 
child.  I will love them, advocate, give them a home and a family, 
and be the nurse, but I still need a little more help.  Thank you.

story:
Our Story

Last year, 185 active-duty Army soldiers committed suicide, which is more than the 176 soldiers killed in battle in Afghanistan in the same year. Since 2001, the Army's annual death toll from suicide has more than tripled, with other branches experiencing similar statistics.  Less reported is the impact to military families when their service member struggles with pain, traumatic brain injuries and post traumatic stress.

It's time to take action.  Healing Warriors Program is a Registered Vendor with the Denver and Cheyenne VA Medical Centers.  We launched our first clinic offering  non-invasive therapies for pain, PTSD, anxiety and other ailments in July 2013. 

The goal of the Healing Warriors Program is to provide integrated therapy options and self-care training to manage and alleviate pain, PTSD, and other symptoms from the injuries experienced by service men and women and their families.

Why Healing Warriors Program?

In just a few short months,  we have delivered over 75 sessions.  The Healing Warriors Program clinic is a success!

Since opening our doors in July, we have experienced exponential month-over-month growth. Demands for our services are increasing rapidly and our recent filing for registered vendor status with the VA is further growing our referral network. We are making a difference providing relief for service members and their families.  This is why we are here. 

Simply put, we need Clinic Space! 

Healing Warriors Program (HWP) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization. The HWP clinics are necessary and effective. Our therapy options are helping  service members and their families with relief of pain, anxiety, stress, and sleep disorders,  and is improving their overall day-to-day quality of life.  We are thrilled at our faster than anticipated growth, but realize that we are outgrowing our space faster than we had expected. This will soon result in treatment delays that are so vital to the continued good health of this community.  Your contribution directly funds the Healing Warriors Program clinics,  ensuring that we can deliver timely treatments to the service men and women, and their families, who so desperately need these services.

 Where Does the Money Go?

We provide five sessions at no charge to the Service member and their family, with additional sessions offered at the subsidized rate of $30. Your donation goes directly to pay for clinic space.  We are asking for your support in giving us a safe, clean and warm place where we can provide these much needed clinic services.

Join us in making a difference in the lives of service members and their families so that together we can achieve wellness and healing.  Help us support a shift towards a healthier, more holistic model for wellness. Remember, what we do here today with our returning veterans will impact generations to come. Let's join together to help with pain, anxiety, stress and trauma and the well-being of our military families. Let's join together as a community. We can do it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about the work we are doing.  Many of us know a service member or a service family.  Let them know we are here.  Let them know they can come in for services. 

We are often asked if someone can come to the clinic from out of town to obtain services.  The answer is YES.  We are here to serve and support our service member community.  

We have a growing veteran population with severe pain, traumatic brain injuries and PTSD issues.   Together we make a difference.  Together we create a new and brighter tomorrow..

story:
Thirsty To Live Longer

Thirsty to live longer is a campaign that we started in the beginning of 2015. Our platform is to help people get involved in a healthy lifestyle and to raise awareness of  the dangers of excessive consumption of sweetners in the American diet. Nutrition is the foundation of leading a healthy life, and moderation is the building blocks.  Too much high fructose corn syrup, and refined sugars are the leading cause of metabolic disorders such as chronic exhaustion, obesity, diabetes type II and many other disorders.  Along with the excessive consumption of sweeteners we also have to include lack of physical activity.  It is not just adults who are lacking physical activity but an even greater problem exists with the children of this generation.  This problem is not only in America, but worldwide. 
 More and more individuals have become sedentary and less active which is the leading cause of new health issues.  These new health issues are often called hypokinetic disorders which literally means disorders resulting from lack of motion. The decrease in physical activity in our society has contributed substantially to the current high mortality rates from these disorders, so its obvious that we need to become more active but its hard for us when we are so busy with so many other things to do. Ontop of that most people are usually exhausted by the afternoon hour.
So what does our society do about our lack of human energy?  Well the manufactering industry figured out the human body needs energy. So energy drinks, sports drinks, and sugary drinks were developed as the solution.  Which is great! However, most of these drinks are providing energy but they are also causing negative side effects.  These negative side effects are working long term against the human body. When you consume these drinks your body has energy for a while your heart is pumping in overdrive and then BAAAM! Extreme exhaustion-(the crash effect) sets in.  Why?  The number 1 reason is your body has become dehydrated.  Your body is lacking essential powerhouse nutrients to keep it going.
 founder and creator-(Rodney Dale Crowley)
 After realizing the vicious cycle the human body was going through from the injestion of these drinks, I was determined to create a natural energy drink that had positive side effects, no crash effect, and a great taste.  Realizing todays nutritional information only provided half of the answers,  l decided to start researching the diet of our ancestors 7000 years ago.  After 4 years of indepth research of cross referencing current science books-(Human Anatomy, Human Physiology, Nutrition, Chemistry, Microbiology) with ancient modern historical books-(the Bible, Ice Age, Prehistoric World, Stone Age Civilizations etc.) and over 200 human test subjects myself included, Redox Plant Based Energy was finally formulated.  A perfect balance of essential natural nutrients: electrolytes, enzymes, vitamins, minerals, and so much more.

What is Redox Plant Based Energy

Redox Plant Based Energy contains a myriad of wonderful ingredients. Check out these amazing ingredients.


Redox Plant Based Energy is considered a nutraceutical product, a fortified food, or dietary supplement. It is all natural and has a special blend of amazing ingredients that is good for the human body.  Anyone 8 years or older can consume this beverage. 

Why we need your contributions

We are operating in a small facility-(church kitchen) with a crew of 4 people.  The demand for this product is growing very fast.  Although this is good for business, it has become difficult to work in a small kitchen area and keep up with orders that are bombarding us daily.  The equipment we are using can't handle the high work load and is continuously breaking down.  This causes us to miss important deadlines producing, packaging, and shipping these orders to our valued customers. Redox Plant Based Energy has been on the open market for 2 years now and is in a few convenience stores, fitness centers, and established businesses in Victoria, Texas. We also have about 30 valued customer accounts around Texas and about 10 valued customer accounts out of state.

 We need powerful industrial equipment that can handle the workload more effectively and efficiently, as well as a spacious building that can store it.  We also need at least 3 more people to help in the production of products.  Thats why your contributions are very important to us and any amount that you give is greatly appreciated.  
Once we reach our funding goal our mission is to provide this product nationwide and eventually worldwide.  Once we reach full production 5% of profits will go to a childhood obesity foundation to help children with this terrible disease.  Obesity is the precursor disease that leads to major metabolic and hypokenetic disorders.

story:
The Boy Scouts of America builds leaders in boys from ages 11 to 18. One of the many ways this happens is by sending the boys to scout camp. We have a local treasure in Pico Blanco boy scout camp located in Big Sur, CA. The boys develop new skills, fall in love with the outdoors, earn respect from themselves and others, learn how to negotiate life's quirks AND have an extremely high amount of fun doing all this. Scout Camp opens their world up in unimaginable ways.  We have over 25 boys signed up for scout camp 2015.  We need to raise money for camp fees & equipment and these costs are right about $200 to $400 per person. We have several boys who cannot afford this right now.

To raise funds, we are holding a Rummage sale April 11th and could use your quality gently used items. We/I can pick the items up! You can also stop by and BUY items on April 11th. We already have A LOT OF VERY COOL STUFF! The location is 742 Neeson Rd in Marina CA. WAIT... HOLD ON!... What's that, you say? ...You don't have any quality items to donate or aren't local and/or cannot make it to the rummage sale on April 11th ....so you are now perplexed because you think you can't help with the Rummage Sale fundraiser... but you really do want to help out? GOOD NEWS! That is what this donation page is for :) Click on the "Donate" button and do some good for a scout you might know. and... THANK YOU!

Scout Motto: "Do a good turn daily"

story:
Water Well Project will help people who don't have access to clean drinking water.

More than 9,000 people die everyday due to lack of clean water, especially as the drought threat is growing more severe in large parts of the world now (1). In addition to drinking, the contaminated water is also used for cleaning and cooking. While trying to access clean water sources currently available, the majority of people carrying them home are women and children whom walk as far as 3-5 miles.  Because of the long and difficult journey, children are often missing out on an education and women on work. This results in missed work, school and exposing them to traffic accidents while crossing roads or even to sexual assault.

Africa is one of the most affected areas from drought and this campaign gives you an opportunity to help thousands of people (on average 1,000 people benefit from each well; mostly children) to access clean water. We are planning to build 4 wells in Uganda. Each well will cost $4,500.

Your contribution will help us build wells incrementally (e.g. $4,500 will build one well and the total target of $18,000 will build all 4 wells). Exceeding amounts collected will result in building additional wells. You will receive a tax deductible donation receipt from Embrace Relief, which is a nonprofit with 501 (c) (3) organization.

In addition, for donors of $100 and more, Embrace Relief will provide an appreciation certificate that includes your name, picture and GPS coordinates of the related well once completed. Each water well takes 8 to 10 weeks to build in Uganda. If you decide to donate for one entire well yourself or your family, the well can be named after you or your family and will be reflected with a certificate and pictures.

We work with proven partners that have opened over 150 fresh water wells following acceptable standards and hygiene. After building the wells, Embrace Relief will follow up and monitor the project to ensure your help has a long-term impact.

For clean water, all we do is to turn the faucet on. We take it for granted every day.

Help thousands permanently access clean water with your donation.

(1) World Health Organization (WHO). (2008). Safer Water, Better Health: Costs, benefits, and sustainability of interventions to protect and promote health

story: The Fighting Farmers of America qualified for US Quidditch Cup in Texas on April 14th and 15th. In order to do so, we need your help! We need roughly $10,000 to get our team there to cover tournament fees, transportation, and hotels. We would appreciate any donation to help us get there!

story:
Coros™ OMNI smart cycling helmet is designed to help you get the most enjoyment and awareness out of your ride while enhancing safety. Coros™ OMNI - helmet, smart remote, and mobile app – delivers smartphone connectivity, two-way audio, and instant accessibility, all packed into a high performance, multipurpose helmet. Open-ear bone conduction audio - no wires, no earbuds, no safety compromises – links to your music, friends, bike mates, navigation, and ride data to enrich the ultimate riding experience. 


Bone conduction bypasses the eardrums so your ears remain open and unimpeded. Sound waves are converted into vibrations and delivered through your upper cheekbones. The cochlea receives the vibrations, bypassing the ear canal and eardrum. For cyclists, this is super important because that means you can hear audio and hear your surroundings as you ride, such as cars and other potentially dangerous obstacles.

OMNI includes a built-in day/night LED safety illumination feature designed to provide maximum visibility, day and night. The LED illumination feature automatically activates at dusk via a built-in light sensor.  The light can also be activated via the handlebar mounted smart remote during day or night.

Included with the Coros™ OMNI system is the handlebar mounted Coros™ Smart Remote. Control volume, skip tracks, pause music, take calls, activate built-in safety light, record ride data and more without stopping to fumble with your phone. Easy to install on any handlebar, it gives riders an easy, safe way to stay connected while they ride.

Available for Apple iOS or Android. Use the app to connect your helmet, the Coros™ OMNI Smart Remote and smartphone. Track your rides and ride history to include distance, time, average speed, max speed, calories burned, elevation and more. Connect and sync your ride data with popular apps such as STRAVA™ and MapMyRide. 

Not only is OMNI a multi-purpose hybrid smart cycling helmet, it has been designed for all weather use.  OMNI is fully functional in sub-freezing temperatures and performs in temperate climates exceeding 100°F. With an (IPX5) water resistance rating, OMNI is resistant to rain, snow, water, splash, and sweat. Essentially, OMNI will go wherever your ride takes you.

OMNI is lighter, cooler, and smarter than it's predecessor. We've dropped more than 40 grams to reach a respectable 340 total grams. Equally important, we increased airflow with 18 total vents for a lightweight and cool ride. For a striking visual, we're really excited about the look of OMNI and four matte color options giving you a helmet choice to match every ride and cycling kit. Choose from Matte Blue/Black/White, Matte White, Matte Red, and Matte Black.  Shown below with and without snap-on sun visor.

In addition to being recognized as a CES Innovations Award 2018 Honoree, OMNI is being reviewed and recognized by many in the cycling, fitness, and outdoor media.  Some of the recent coverage is posted below:​ 

Coros™ has been evaluating the concept of OMNI since January 2017, when LINX was launched at the 2017 Consumer Electronics Show (CES). Although the past year has been a focus on features, benefits, design, and quality assurance, we're already beyond the prototype and Alpha/Beta test phase. We're pleased to acknowledge 2,500 OMNI helmets are currently in production. Shipments to Indiegogo backers in the U.S./Canada, South America, the E.U./Europe, Asia, and Australia will commence in January 2018, with the goal to have all orders delivered to all backers by the end of February 2018. 

Coros™ is committed to serving the global cycling community by offering products that not only make cycling safer but also more enjoyable and connected. Your support helps facilitate the design, development, testing, and production of high technology products that bring together riders and elevate the overall riding experience. This campaign, in particular, will support the development of OMNI and specific features that cyclists tell us are critical such as; an enhanced smartphone application, improved bone conduction audio, and the introduction of LED safety illumination.  These features and improvements have been at the top of the list in customer feedback sessions, regional cycling events, and outdoor/fitness trade events. We appreciate your interest, we look forward to your backing, and most of all - stay connected and ride safe!

Coros™ Wearables Inc. is a year old start-up focused on the convergence of connectivity, safety, technology and the active outdoor lifestyle.  As a team, we conceive, design, test, manufacture, and market technology-based sports gear that provides enjoyable, social, safe, and performance-boosting outdoor sports and fitness experiences.  

Coros has successfully launched a Kickstarter project in 2017 (Coros LINX Smart Cycling Helmet). Throughout 2017, we improved our concept, design, molding, prototyping, bone conduction technology, and manufacturing of high-quality outdoor fitness/cycling equipment and consumer electronics.  In addition to improving our design and build process, we have hired a team of experienced leaders, marketers, sales staff, and operational vendors to help us with supply chain and fulfillment procedures. As a result of our 2017 improvements and investments in physical and human capital, we have more confidence in delivering a premium product on time as expected.  These investments will improve our manufacturing, distribution, and delivery timeline considerably compared to the standard crowdfunding campaigns that do not have our background or experience.  Our manufacturing is already producing OMNI helmets, so we really see a future with limited risk & minimal challenge!

Q:  I just backed Coros OMNI, when will I get the helmet?
A:  We are confident that we will be shipping OMNI right after the campaign is over. In the U.S., Canada, once a shipping confirmation is sent, you should receive your package in 4-5 business days. International backers can expect to receive packages within 5-10 business days. You can track your status by tracking number from shipping origination to your door.

Q:  How will I know when my OMNI has shipped?
A:  You will receive an email with a tracking number when your OMNI ships. 

Q:  How will my OMNI be shipped?
A:  In the U.S. and Canada, shipping will be handled via the UPS or USPS. International shipments will depend on region.

Q:  How can I help Coros build the Coros community of cyclists?
A:  We would love it if you told your cycling friends, your old roommates, your neighbors, and the guy sitting next to you at the bar. Chat it up, send emails, or just post on Facebook. All word of mouth is great. We truly appreciate it. We will be establishing an ambassador program, so check with us later about that.

Q:  What kind of warranty does OMNI come with?
A:  Your helmet comes with a limited one-year warranty from the original date of purchase. We also offer an impact replacement program. Please review the Warranty Policy for more details. Keep your Indiegogo e-mail receipt!

Q:  Are the helmets safe and certified?
A:  We built OMNI first and foremost with safety in mind. Our helmets are serious gear, and currently, safety certified in the U.S. ,Europe, Australia and New Zealand. Our value proposition is improving biker safety by developing a safe alternative to unsafe earbuds so people can be aware of their environment while still enjoying their music, calls, etc. Lastly, OMNI includes an emergency alert in the event of a hard impact to the helmet.

Q:  Does OMNI work with other phones and devices that are not Android or IOS phones?
A:  OMNI works with devices that are Bluetooth enabled; it would work like a wireless Bluetooth headset. You will get music, calls, and other audio from your phone. There is quite a bit of benefit from this. However, you lose out on cool benefits from the smart remote, app, and emergency alert functionality.

Q:  Is the OMNI waterproof?
A:  No. OMNI and the smart remote are designed to be dust, sweat and water-resistant to handle the wear of everyday use of rigorous cycling and inclement weather. OMNI is resistant to rain, snow, sweat, and light moisture, however, OMNI cannot be submerged in water. OMNI should be stored in a cool dry space when not in use.

Q:  How does the battery work?
A:  The internal helmet battery is charged through standard micro-USB charging cable (provided), and has 8+ hours of play/talk time.

Q:  Do I need to carry my phone?
A:  To get the full benefit of Coros OMNI Smart Helmet, you need to have your Bluetooth-enabled device with you so it's in Bluetooth proximity. However, if you want to ride disconnected for a bit, just put the helmet on and ride with the same safety benefits of a non-tech enabled helmet.

Q:  What happens if I have a cycling accident and my Coros helmet is damaged?
A:  If you are unfortunate enough to be involved in an accident and the impact damages your helmet we will provide you with a new helmet at a discount. Please review the Impact Replacement Policy at www.coros.com for more details.

Q:  How does the Coros Smart remote work?
A:  The OMNI smart remote connects to your smartphone via Bluetooth. Once paired and attached to your bicycle handlebars the remote will allow you to: listen to music and GPS instructions, skip to the next track, change the volume, and accept and hang up phone calls. NOTE: The smart remote requires a 2032 cell battery (included). To make sure the battery works, press the center button – it will light up if the battery is working.
story_txt: Coros™ OMNI smart cycling helmet is designed to help you get the most enjoyment and awareness out of your ride while enhancing safety. Coros™ OMNI - helmet, smart remote, and mobile app – delivers smartphone connectivity, two-way audio, and instant accessibility, all packed into a high performance, multipurpose helmet. Open-ear bone conduction audio - no wires, no earbuds, no safety compromises – links to your music, friends, bike mates, navigation, and ride data to enrich the ultimate riding experience. Bone conduction bypasses the eardrums so your ears remain open and unimpeded. Sound waves are converted into vibrations and delivered through your upper cheekbones. The cochlea receives the vibrations, bypassing the ear canal and eardrum. For cyclists, this is super important because that means you can hear audio and hear your surroundings as you ride, such as cars and other potentially dangerous obstacles.OMNI includes a built-in day/night LED safety illumination feature designed to provide maximum visibility, day and night. The LED illumination feature automatically activates at dusk via a built-in light sensor.  The light can also be activated via the handlebar mounted smart remote during day or night.Included with the Coros™ OMNI system is the handlebar mounted Coros™ Smart Remote. Control volume, skip tracks, pause music, take calls, activate built-in safety light, record ride data and more without stopping to fumble with your phone. Easy to install on any handlebar, it gives riders an easy, safe way to stay connected while they ride.Available for Apple iOS or Android. Use the app to connect your helmet, the Coros™ OMNI Smart Remote and smartphone. Track your rides and ride history to include distance, time, average speed, max speed, calories burned, elevation and more. Connect and sync your ride data with popular apps such as STRAVA™ and MapMyRide. Not only is OMNI a multi-purpose hybrid smart cycling helmet, it has been designed for all weather use.  OMNI is fully functional in sub-freezing temperatures and performs in temperate climates exceeding 100°F. With an (IPX5) water resistance rating, OMNI is resistant to rain, snow, water, splash, and sweat. Essentially, OMNI will go wherever your ride takes you.OMNI is lighter, cooler, and smarter than it's predecessor. We've dropped more than 40 grams to reach a respectable 340 total grams. Equally important, we increased airflow with 18 total vents for a lightweight and cool ride. For a striking visual, we're really excited about the look of OMNI and four matte color options giving you a helmet choice to match every ride and cycling kit. Choose from Matte Blue/Black/White, Matte White, Matte Red, and Matte Black.  Shown below with and without snap-on sun visor.In addition to being recognized as a CES Innovations Award 2018 Honoree, OMNI is being reviewed and recognized by many in the cycling, fitness, and outdoor media.  Some of the recent coverage is posted below:​ Coros™ has been evaluating the concept of OMNI since January 2017, when LINX was launched at the 2017 Consumer Electronics Show (CES). Although the past year has been a focus on features, benefits, design, and quality assurance, we're already beyond the prototype and Alpha/Beta test phase. We're pleased to acknowledge 2,500 OMNI helmets are currently in production. Shipments to Indiegogo backers in the U.S./Canada, South America, the E.U./Europe, Asia, and Australia will commence in January 2018, with the goal to have all orders delivered to all backers by the end of February 2018. Coros™ is committed to serving the global cycling community by offering products that not only make cycling safer but also more enjoyable and connected. Your support helps facilitate the design, development, testing, and production of high technology products that bring together riders and elevate the overall riding experience. This campaign, in particular, will support the development of OMNI and specific features that cyclists tell us are critical such as; an enhanced smartphone application, improved bone conduction audio, and the introduction of LED safety illumination.  These features and improvements have been at the top of the list in customer feedback sessions, regional cycling events, and outdoor/fitness trade events. We appreciate your interest, we look forward to your backing, and most of all - stay connected and ride safe!Coros™ Wearables Inc. is a year old start-up focused on the convergence of connectivity, safety, technology and the active outdoor lifestyle.  As a team, we conceive, design, test, manufacture, and market technology-based sports gear that provides enjoyable, social, safe, and performance-boosting outdoor sports and fitness experiences.  Coros has successfully launched a Kickstarter project in 2017 (Coros LINX Smart Cycling Helmet). Throughout 2017, we improved our concept, design, molding, prototyping, bone conduction technology, and manufacturing of high-quality outdoor fitness/cycling equipment and consumer electronics.  In addition to improving our design and build process, we have hired a team of experienced leaders, marketers, sales staff, and operational vendors to help us with supply chain and fulfillment procedures. As a result of our 2017 improvements and investments in physical and human capital, we have more confidence in delivering a premium product on time as expected.  These investments will improve our manufacturing, distribution, and delivery timeline considerably compared to the standard crowdfunding campaigns that do not have our background or experience.  Our manufacturing is already producing OMNI helmets, so we really see a future with limited risk & minimal challenge!Q:  I just backed Coros OMNI, when will I get the helmet?A:  We are confident that we will be shipping OMNI right after the campaign is over. In the U.S., Canada, once a shipping confirmation is sent, you should receive your package in 4-5 business days. International backers can expect to receive packages within 5-10 business days. You can track your status by tracking number from shipping origination to your door.Q:  How will I know when my OMNI has shipped?A:  You will receive an email with a tracking number when your OMNI ships. Q:  How will my OMNI be shipped?A:  In the U.S. and Canada, shipping will be handled via the UPS or USPS. International shipments will depend on region.Q:  How can I help Coros build the Coros community of cyclists?A:  We would love it if you told your cycling friends, your old roommates, your neighbors, and the guy sitting next to you at the bar. Chat it up, send emails, or just post on Facebook. All word of mouth is great. We truly appreciate it. We will be establishing an ambassador program, so check with us later about that.Q:  What kind of warranty does OMNI come with?A:  Your helmet comes with a limited one-year warranty from the original date of purchase. We also offer an impact replacement program. Please review the Warranty Policy for more details. Keep your Indiegogo e-mail receipt!Q:  Are the helmets safe and certified?A:  We built OMNI first and foremost with safety in mind. Our helmets are serious gear, and currently, safety certified in the U.S. ,Europe, Australia and New Zealand. Our value proposition is improving biker safety by developing a safe alternative to unsafe earbuds so people can be aware of their environment while still enjoying their music, calls, etc. Lastly, OMNI includes an emergency alert in the event of a hard impact to the helmet.Q:  Does OMNI work with other phones and devices that are not Android or IOS phones?A:  OMNI works with devices that are Bluetooth enabled; it would work like a wireless Bluetooth headset. You will get music, calls, and other audio from your phone. There is quite a bit of benefit from this. However, you lose out on cool benefits from the smart remote, app, and emergency alert functionality.Q:  Is the OMNI waterproof?A:  No. OMNI and the smart remote are designed to be dust, sweat and water-resistant to handle the wear of everyday use of rigorous cycling and inclement weather. OMNI is resistant to rain, snow, sweat, and light moisture, however, OMNI cannot be submerged in water. OMNI should be stored in a cool dry space when not in use.Q:  How does the battery work?A:  The internal helmet battery is charged through standard micro-USB charging cable (provided), and has 8+ hours of play/talk time.Q:  Do I need to carry my phone?A:  To get the full benefit of Coros OMNI Smart Helmet, you need to have your Bluetooth-enabled device with you so it's in Bluetooth proximity. However, if you want to ride disconnected for a bit, just put the helmet on and ride with the same safety benefits of a non-tech enabled helmet.Q:  What happens if I have a cycling accident and my Coros helmet is damaged?A:  If you are unfortunate enough to be involved in an accident and the impact damages your helmet we will provide you with a new helmet at a discount. Please review the Impact Replacement Policy at www.coros.com for more details.Q:  How does the Coros Smart remote work?A:  The OMNI smart remote connects to your smartphone via Bluetooth. Once paired and attached to your bicycle handlebars the remote will allow you to: listen to music and GPS instructions, skip to the next track, change the volume, and accept and hang up phone calls. NOTE: The smart remote requires a 2032 cell battery (included). To make sure the battery works, press the center button – it will light up if the battery is working.

story:
Short Summary

Galloway Chillies is a small business based in South West Scotland (not far from Wigtown – Scotland’s National Book Town). We grow chilli plants, from the mild through to the super hot, and produce a range of chilli based preserve products for sale to trade and direct to customers.

We are passionate about seasonal and local produce. Our ingredient sourcing policy has a strong emphasis on seasonal and locally grown produce. In fact we are so passionate about local produce that we are growing over 100 varieties of chillies this year and even have lemons growing in our tunnel in Scotland! Now who says that Scotland is too cold?

We’ve invested everything we have into the business which has mostly gone into the growing of the chillies. However, I believe that to make this business a success we have to show exactly where our main ingredient comes from and without the chilli plants there would be no business.



What We Need & What You Get

We urgently need a van for the business. We have relied heavily on our car until recently and the occasional hire of a van but we cannot continue to run the business this way. As you can guess our jars are not light and if we had a van it would enable us to take a wider range of stock to events and also to travel further afield. We would also be able to attend events with our gazebo which is something we cannot do at present due to weight and lack of space. A number of events do not supply stalls and expect you to use your own gazebo, so unfortunately we aren’t able to attend these events presently. We would also be able to undertake deliveries to stockists too which would make a big difference to them and us. 

As a thank you we have a number of perks to give in return for pledges, which will include a limited edition preserve. Yes, we will make a one off chilli preserve never to be made again as a thank you to everyone who supports us in this venture.

Every crowdfunder will also automatically become a member of the 'hot wheels' club. You will automatically receive an invite to any launch parties we may have but also be the first to know of new products and will periodically receive discount codes for our online shop.

As stated previously all the funds we had are already invested into the business and we feel that the only option we have to get a van is by crowdfunding. 


The Impact

Galloway Chillies has been tingling not only the taste buds of our customers but also hoteliers, chefs and judges. Yes, we have won quite a few awards, with two main highlights this year of being shortlisted in the Scotland Food and Drink awards and the ultimate accolade of being placed second in the World Hot Sauce competition. The purchase of a van is so important for the business to continue growing and spreading the Wildfire.

Should we be fortunate enough to exceed our goal then we will utilise the funds to sign write the van. This will include the statement that the van was supported through crowdfunding with a link to our website where all the lovely people who supported us will be listed.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can also do us a massive favour by spreading the word about this campaign. Do you know someone in your life who loves chillies, then introduce them to Galloway Chillies. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and if you would like to keep informed of how the business is progressing then please sign up to our newsletter or you can follow us and spread the word on Facebook and Twitter.
