story:
Pre-enroll a medical student in the Science of Compassion for Healthcare Providers Course as part of the new Wellsmart/Indiegogo Scholarship Fund.

Read more on our Updates page!


The goal of this fundraiser is to produce  2 online courses: one for healthcare providers and one for patients/general public, as phase 1 of Wellsmart's 3-phase growth plan. 

We need to get the 'care' back into healthcare, and if we don't like the path we are on, weʼd better get busy paving a new one. 


Hello, I'm Dr. Amy Coleman and I've had the vision of Wellsmart since I was 8 years old. Why? I saw everyone in my family confused about what the doctor told them, and fearful about their diagnoses. I saw them without knowledge of the language of medicine, feeling separate from the true peace of mind that they had hoped for.  They mostly saw themselves as a victim, awash in an uncomfortable system.  I wanted to crack the code of this system and come back as an interpreter for them of the confusing language and concepts, while also empowering them to realize that  their health lay within the power of their own selves. 

Together we can make a difference, to empower patients with accessible, relevant medical education and to teach healthcare providers to embrace the the practice of medicine with renewed passion and new inspiration through the applied science of empathy and compassion. Click here to read more about Wellsmart's dedicated and enthusiastic team.



For patients (like you!):

  • Patients are easily lost in the mix of information overload, and need a navigational beacon to know what information to trust. 
  • Doctors are currently not available or capable of taking a valuable educational time-out with their patients.
  • 'Google-itis' and 'cyber-hypochondria' are the results of too much information about health found online without any education or context provided, which can cause a great deal of anxiety for patients. 
What is needed is a mini-medical education course for patients to increase their resilience, empowerment, and wisdom.


For healthcare providers:

  • Doctors are made in educational systems which do not teach or support, to any extent, an ability to relate to their patient. 
  • Many providers start with a spark of compassion that loses its lustre toward the end of medical school, then nearly extinguished with the rigors of residency. 
  • Cynicism and higher levels of dissatisfaction builds toward their chosen career path.

This means physicians are leaving the profession despite our need for them to stay, a need that is at an all-time high, and one that will keep growing.


For patients:

The Patient's Mini-Medical School is a backstage look at the conversations that caring doctors have with their patients: wise council, ah-ha moments, and true insights that redirect patients in gaining clarity regarding their own medical knowledge and knowledge of themselves.  The course offers real context and education in this new era of information overload. 

For healthcare providers:

There are certification programs for how well you can memorize facts, but what about a certification program for learning the the application of these forms of emotional intelligence? 

The Science of Compassion for Healthcare Providers course will focus on how empathy and compassion are the foundation from which ANY diagnosis or patient assessment begins. A physician must not only be a good detective, but also a detective with an open heart to truly get at the core of the problem.  We are not just dealing with a patient’s bodily tissues; we must also remember the spiritually sensitive tissue that is their souls.  When we as providers are able to understand this, we will help patients reconnect to this wisdom for themselves. 

From a scientific standpoint, empathy can be addressed as emotional or integrative intelligence and is taught with the backing of cutting edge research in the field of advanced biofeedback concepts, power of human focus/attention, and physics. 

Wellsmart courses for providers will also offer accreditation and continuing medical education value.




The funding received will be split in to 3, as per the chart above. Our video production schedule of 5 videos every 2 weeks will allow us to complete 20 videos for each course in time for a September 2015 launch.


At the heart of Wellsmart is a community of wellness and healing, a community that can make a difference in how primary care is delivered. We can accomplish this by bringing together expertise and mutual interest from both providers and patients to grow this movement toward accessible, trustworthy, and compassionate healthcare. Crowdfunding will support his goal by raising awareness, encouraging discussion, and (we hope!) building enthusiasm.
Alongside financial contributions, other ways to help include:
  • Sharing this campaign with family, friends, and colleagues using the short URL igg.me/at/Wellsmart 
  • Sharing your stories with us via email or commenting on our blog.
  • Writing a blog post about our campaign and compassionate healthcare movement
  • Following us on Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube. 

We'll be posting video and text updates during the campaign, and funders will receive email notifications


Join the movement. Take charge of your well-being and support the return of  'care' back into healthcare.


All photos by Harris & Ward

Join the movement. Take charge of your well-being and support the return of  'care' back into healthcare.

All photos by Harris & Ward

story:
Japanese Page

弊社ホームページへのアクセスが集中した場合もこちらのサイトが表示されるようになっております。ご了承ください。

AYATORIは、人と人を光でつなげるロマンチックなスマホアクセサリーです。

自分の趣味を登録して同じ趣味の相手と近づくと「AYATORI」がそっと光り出し、ふたりのつながりを演出します。

パーティイベントやバーで、誰かと話したくてもきっかけがなくて話せない、そんな人の最初の一歩を後押しします。



AYATORIの操作は非常にシンプルです。
iPhoneにAYATORIを装着し、専用のアプリで自分の趣味や好きなものを登録するだけで、同じ趣味を登録している人を探し出します。もし近くに相手がいるとお互いのAYATORIが光り出します。
画面での操作はほとんど必要なく、AYATORIの光がふたりの繋がりを瞬時に可視化します。




近くにいるけど話したこと無い人とのコミュニケーション、それは今までのスマートフォンでは実現できませんでした。私たちはiBeaconと光るスマホアクセサリーを組み合わせることで、スマートフォンの力を拡張し、新しいコミュニケーション体験をご提供します。

<HARDWARE>

AYATORIは、基板には超高輝度なLEDを搭載し、イヤホンジャックから出た音を光に変換しています。外装は透明な素材に拡散剤を混ぜ、光がロウソクの炎のようにふわっと灯るように試作を繰り返しました。

<SOFTWARE>

iBeaconというBluetoothの電波を発信・受信することで、数十cm～数十mにいる相手を特定することができます。圏外での利用や、バックグラウンドでのプッシュ通知が可能です。

アプリはすでにAppStoreにリリースしており、クラウドファンディングにご支援頂いた方から優先的にAYATORIをご体験頂けます。(アプリのDLはコチラ)



様々なイベントでAYATORIを導入して頂いています。 今回のクラウドファンディングを通して量産の目処が整えば、さらに多くのイベントで導入することが可能になります。

2014.09.10 iBeacon恋活

2014年9月10日に開催されたiBeacon恋活にAYATORIを導入頂きました。

2014.09.21 ロイヤルウィングでランチバイキング!!〜ランチクルーズ編〜

2014年9月21日に開催されたバスツアーの企画としてAYATORIを導入頂きました。

2014.09.23 バルタウン

バルタウン中目黒でAYATORIを導入頂く予定です。



クラウドファンディングにご支援頂いた方には、ささやかではありますが、下記の特典をプレゼント致します。そしてさらに、$25以上ご支援頂いた方にはAYATORIを使ったパーティー・イベントにご招待します。

(クラウドファンディングへの支援方法)

商品のお届時期は2014年12月を予定しています。



AYATORI MATCHをイベントやお店のグッズとして導入してみませんか？

パーティ/イベントで、BARやカフェでお客さん同士の新たな出会いを作ることで、リピーターの獲得やコミュニティの活性化につながります。

AYATORI導入のお問い合わせはコチラ



AYATORIがあれば、アプリをダウンロードするだけで違う楽しみ方ができます。 ある時はライブのペンライトに、ある時は言葉にできない気持ちを伝えるメッセージに- AYATORIは、あなたの生活のあらゆる場面をそっと照らしていきます。

イベントに一体感を生み出すペンライト型アプリ(開発中)

振ったら光る、アーティストのコントロールに合わせて光る、みんなでゲージを貯めたら光る等、スマートフォンの機能を生かした遊び方ができます。ライブ、ウェディング、スポーツ観戦、友人とのカラオケなど、様々なシーンでみんなで光のエンターテイメントを楽しめます。

デモムービーはコチラ

恋人同士が光で気持ちを伝え合う、非言語コミュニケーションアプリ(開発中)

言葉にできない「気持ち」を込めて、ボタンを押すと、相手のAYATORIがそっと点滅します。




English Page

"Japan’s Vinclu launches Indiegogo campaign for light communication appcessory"



AYATORI is a smartphone "appcessory" that connects people through romantic light. 


Once AYATORI is plugged into your smartphone’s earphone jack,
you will open a dreamy way of communication through light by using AYATORI App.


”Appcessory" is a combined word of app and accessory. 

By combining an application and an accessory, we have created a completely new form of communication flapping outside of the screen.


Currently, we are developing three iPhone APPs that work with AYATORI:

"AYATORI MATCH",  "AYATORI LIVE" and "AYATORI PAIR".

All three Apps will be released in this year, and will be available at the same time as AYATORI. 


[AYATORI MATCH] 
Passing communication App which does not miss a fateful encounter.

You register your interests on the App and then, when you pass by someone who has the same interests, both of your AYATORIs light up. 

When you’re at a party and you want to talk to someone, but you can’t find an opportunity, this can be the first step towards beginning a conversation.

Single Plan is recommended if you are currently single.


[AYATORI LIVE]
Live event App that works as advanced penlight and creates a feeling of unity.


At events, AYATORI helps foster a sense of community.

There are many ways to leverage your smartphone’s capabilities and play with AYATORI at an event, including having it light up as you swing your phone, connecting it to a controller managed by an artist, and having it shine when everyone’s energy gets powered up. 

You can enjoy this “light entertainment” with friends at live shows, weddings, sporting events, at karaoke, and other similar events.

Ranger Plan is recommended if you love Live concert or Karaoke.
 This plan include 5 colors AYATORI that heat up the situation.

[AYATORI PAIR]
Nonverbal communication App for lovers.


Words are unnecessary between certain people.

AYATORI can also be used for non-verbal communication with the "pair" application that allows partners to express their feelings via light.

Express the feelings you can’t put into words, and when you press a button, your partner’s AYATORI will silently flicker. 

Pair Plan is recommended, if you have love one.
This is LOVEBIRD plan. Your other half will be happy to receive this gift you send!
These three app is free for all AYATORI user.
In addition, we are planing on increase number of apps that linked to AYATORI.
Please look foward to our updates!



“Delivering the feelings that can’t be put into words.” 

Through this project, we would like to realize that ideal. 

As the CEO of this company, why am I crazy about this product? Well, since I was a child, I have been quite poor with words; I’m a person who has a truly hard time expressing my feelings. 

I didn’t achieve significant success at school or work, I didn’t have a lot of friends, and of course, romance never went well for me.  As a result of simply being weak at verbal communication, I have accumulated many regrets in life. 

I often thought to myself, “If I could only express my feelings without words…”

Because so many people now have smartphones, people can easily communicate verbally and textually with other people, regardless of how far away they may be. Moreover, people have begun to use simple communication methods, like Facebook’s emoticons and the ‘Like’ button; I think that non-verbal communication tools such as these will become increasingly popular from now on. 

As a result of the current environment, I set my sights on creating a product based on the concept of "non-verbal communication," and started work on this project.


AYATORI is a tool that combines light and the Internet to allow you to communicate the feelings you can't put into words with the people around you or your loved one far away.

I hope this product can support people like me, who are not gifted with words.




The source code that illuminates AYATORI is open and available to the public, so anyone is able to build a remote communication device.

(It interacts with Javascript and Objective-C) 

We have released an API so that everyone can use AYATORI as they like, and we also organized a hackathon for developing applications related to AYATORI. 

Hacker Plan is the best match if you are a Hacker.
You should be able to understand and hack AYATORI.


We have already held two hackathons for the purpose of developing applications for AYATORI, and even people with no programming experience were able to make AYATORI shine in less than 60 minutes. 

From many participants, we heard, “It was simple and easy to make AYATORI light up!” This is why we think AYATORI could also be used as a learning tool when teaching programming. 

I hope you will use AYATORI as a way of expanding on your ideas and applications. 



AYATORI can create a romantic experience at your event through its original production of light. 

One simple way to achieve this would be by distributing AYATORI accessories and then encouraging participants to install the software. 

It can be used for large events such as parties and concerts, or more everyday events like weddings or after-parties. 

Party Plan and Live Plan is recommended if you are holding an event or party.

Customize

AYATORI’s original design can also be customized, and we can collaborate with companies that have original content and characters. 

We can create original designs to create special experiences for fans from all over the world. 

Partner Plan is recommended if you are the person in charge with company character.


We need your support to bring AYATORI to people around the world! 

Currently, we need initial capital for mass production. Once we've gathered the capital, we'll be able to leverage the strength of our manufacturing partner and we'll be able to create products on a larger scale.

We ask for your heartfelt support! 

People who support our campaign will receive an AYATORI by special delivery in December of 2014. 

If you would really like to try out AYATORI or its companionship applications, or if you’d like to use AYATORI at your next event, please take this opportunity to support our product! 




AYATORI’s features and design are simple, but we've taken great care creating the beauty of its soft light.

The LED of AYATORI is shining by converting sound that flows from earphone jack into electrical current. In addition, AYATORI can flash in various patterns by changing wavelength of sound flowing from the L and R stereo sound. AYATORI is changing the Sound into Light.

The circuit board is equipped with an ultra-bright LED, and takes sound output from the earphone jack and turns it into light. 

For the exterior, we mixed a transparent material with a diffusing agent, testing different combinations until we created a light similar to the weightless flame of a candle. 

AYATORI’s light gently sets the mood, reflecting the dreamy light of your heart, rather than something mechanical and cold.


Why a bird？/ Why "AYATORI"?

As typified by the carrier pigeon, birds have long held the duty of linking people who are far apart. We at Vinclu Inc. felt that such a symbol fit well with our company ideal, of helping to connect people.

We also wanted AYATORI to encompass the idea of connecting you with others, so we picked the design of a cute bird. 

In June 2013, we used the Japanese site CrowdWorks to run a crowdsourcing campaign to find a name. We chose AYATORI out of over 1,000 ideas. 

AYATORI means a “brightly colored bird,” and comes from the Japanese words “aya” and “tori,” which mean "color" and "bird" respectively.

AYATORI also has the meaning of “cat’s cradle” in Japanese. 

Cat’s cradle is a game where you take a single piece of string, make it into a circle, and then go back and forth with a partner, placing it on their fingers and to create different shapes. 

A colorful bird is the perfect match for a product that connects people. 

We also ran a logo crowdsourcing campaign on CrowdWorks, and picked a beautiful design for our brand. 



We've completed the prototype, and are now ready to begin manufacturing on a larger scale. 

With your help we'll be able to immediately move forward with preparations for mass production. 

We'll also be releasing the companion applications by the end of the year, which include everything seen in the video. 

We will start selling AYATORI this year. After that, we will expand our range of companion applications and we'll partner up with other organizations to throw events using AYATORI. 

*As of now, unfortunately, AYATORI does not work with Android. However, in near future, We will develop new AYATORI for Android.

Our company name is vinclu Inc. We began startup to make AYATORI at February 2014.I’d like to create a company that is not just limited to AYATORI, but that makes many products that connect the web and real world. 








Risks and Challenges

We believe the biggest risk is finding a molding process that will allow us to achieve a steady quality of beautiful light in mass production. 

We have commissioned a molding professional for this job, and we are working hard to create a quality product and overcome this challenge. However, if we run into problems with production costs or the quality of light diffusion, it’s possible there could be manufacturing delays. 

We are planning to deliver up to date information step by step as we go through the process, and if delivery is delayed, we will contact supporters as soon as possible. 



FAQ

1. What is support devices of AYATORI?
You can use AYATORI with your iPhone4S (or any later version), your iPod Touch, or your iPad.

2. Can I use AYATORI with Android devices?
As of now, unfortunately, AYATORI does not work with Android. However, in near future, We will develop new AYATORI for Android.

3. Does AYATORI support my language?
First, We will support English and Japanese.
Then, we are going to support other languages​​.

4. How can I choose color of AYATORI?
After achieve support, supporter will recive e-mail to comfirme color.
Please reply to the e-mail.

5. Does AYATORI need battery replacement?
No. Because AYATORI work with smartphone's battery.

6. Will AYATORI light up by just plug it in?
Please use AYATORI linked App to light it up.
App should be release on App Store by the time you receive AYATORI.

7. When will AYATORI arrive?
We are planning on start shipping by December of 2014.

8.If you reach the goal, what will the money be used for?
Any money will be used for mass-production and improve product.

9.Does AYATORI linked App cost?
No. Once you own AYATORI, all linked App are for free.



JOIN

Please check out the following links for the latest information on AYATORI: 

・Web Site　http://vinclu.me

・Facebook Page http://www.facebook.com/vinclu.appcessory

・Instagram http://instagram.com/vinclus

・Twitter http://twitter.com/vinclu_info


Please feel free to contact us with any feedback or requests.

3. Does AYATORI support my language?First, We will support English and Japanese.Then, we are going to support other languages​​.
4. How can I choose color of AYATORI?After achieve support, supporter will recive e-mail to comfirme color.Please reply to the e-mail.
5. Does AYATORI need battery replacement?No. Because AYATORI work with smartphone's battery.
6. Will AYATORI light up by just plug it in?Please use AYATORI linked App to light it up.App should be release on App Store by the time you receive AYATORI.
7. When will AYATORI arrive?We are planning on start shipping by December of 2014.
8.If you reach the goal, what will the money be used for?Any money will be used for mass-production and improve product.
9.Does AYATORI linked App cost?No. Once you own AYATORI, all linked App are for free.


JOIN
Please check out the following links for the latest information on AYATORI: 
・Web Site　http://vinclu.me
・Facebook Page http://www.facebook.com/vinclu.appcessory
・Instagram http://instagram.com/vinclus
・Twitter http://twitter.com/vinclu_info
Please feel free to contact us with any feedback or requests.

story:
Summary

THE JUICE BOX  is devoted to crafting the freshest, most nutrient-packed  juice blends.  Packed with an average of 2 pounds of fresh produce in every bottle, THE JUICE BOX is the only fresh juice high in fiber, plant-based protein and essential omega fatty acids, lowering the glycemic index and allowing you to absorb more of the vital nutrients and live enzymes that is delivered directly to your door.

We make daily juicing convenient and delicious.  THE JUICE BOX subscriptions bring freshly pressed juice to your home or office.

We are committed to being green in more ways than just our ingredients.  It matters to us whom we buy from. It matters to you.  And it certainly matters to our local farmers.  We make a conscious choice to use locally sourced and organic produce whenever possible and recycle our pulp in a variety of ways. 

What We Need  

We need your help to launch our new venture.  We are committed to being a zero-waste business model and must purchase our glass bottle stock, launch a vigorous delivery program and complete the aquisition of delivery vehicles

We aim to raise $30,000 to purchase glass bottles, keeping up to 50,000 plastic bottles out of our city's landfills.  Plus, quality, fresh juice is full of living enzymes and it should never be stored in plastic!  THE JUICE BOX chooses glass bottles to protect the integrity of the juice, but also because we can reuse and recycle them. 

What You Get

Support THE JUICE BOX this month and we'll give you fantastic deals on juice.  The sooner you buy, the better the deals.  We open in October and you can redeem your deals for up to 12 months.  Give THE JUICE BOX as a gift and you might change someone's life. 

How We Got Here

Nearly five years ago, a cancer event in our life made us wake up and realize that we needed to be more mindful of our diet.  We began purchasing and consuming fresh, organic foods. We then moved to a more plant based diet as our palate progressed. We were introduced to juicing as a way to ingest all of the nutrients we needed from veggies.

Our passion for raw juice exploded and turned into gourmet juice blends loaded with natural fiber from whole leaf greens, all types of vegetables, and just about every fruit we could find. The result is a diverse menu of highly nutritious juice blends that even finicky children love to drink.  We can't wait to share it with you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributing to our start-up costs is only one way you can help.

  • Get the word out!  Make some noise about THE JUICE BOX and our pre-sales campaign.

  • Share our website and blog on your Facebook page.

story:
Short Summary

BREAST CANCER
Like me, almost everyone at some time or another knows someone or knows of someone who is fighting this fight. Six months ago, a VERY close family friend of many years confided in me that she was diagnosed with
Triple Negative Breast Cancer. I was completely caught off guard. I remember my immediate inner response was that I was not ready to hear what she was telling me. At this same time I also realized, it wasn't about me.  Without going into details, Triple Negative Breast Cancer is an aggressive subtype of breast cancer and can be difficult to treat. 

I softly asked, "What can I do to help?" A malignant tumor was found in one breast, and for health and personal reasons, she made a decision to have both breasts removed. She recently underwent a preventive double mastectomy. Now, months of chemotherapy lay ahead. She is literally in a fight for her life.

My friend is dearly loved by many. She has been a productive individual all her life, helping out when and wherever she can. Like many of us, she went to work every day and lived a healthy lifestyle to the best of her ability. She adores her husband, children and grandchildren. Over the years, she has taken on the responsibilities of other mothers' children. She remembers the help she received as a young mother with her children. She is employed, but has taken a leave of absence from her job to receive treatments for the cancer.

Although we are hundreds of miles apart, my friend and I talk every day. She keeps me "a-breast" of everything that has to do with her treatments and progress. She has a strong resolve and her mental, spiritual and physical mindset is inspiring.  Some days are good and some days are not. This is understandable. Every day she puts her best effort forward and prays and hopes for the best. Her faith is unyielding.

My friend has an abundance of strong support from family, co-workers, and friends. Even people who do not know her want to help. I can't say enough good things about the hospital staff where she receives her care. Their care with compassion is truly amazing. Her team of nurses, physicians, and nutritionists are awesome! We are all in this fight together with her. There are thousands of women and MEN out there like my friend who is battling this disease. Yes, men have breast tissue and they can develop breast cancer. I would like to do what I can to help. It is said, "Charity begins at home and spreads abroad".

Funds received for this campaign will be used for Treatment and Operations Support. Treatment Support includes, but not limited to: Help and Assistance for Uninsured and Underinsured women and men, FREE or Low Cost Breast Health Services, Breast Health Education, Clinical Breast Exams, Mammograms, Diagnostic Services, Treatment Support, Patient Navigation, Transportation to and from Appointments, Emergency Financial Assistance, and Household Assistance.

NOTE TO DONORS AND SUPPORTERS: This campaign effort was built with honesty and integrity. If you would like to make a donation or purchase merchandise and apparel created for this campaign, please visit my website www.cafepress.com/partnersforever If you choose to make your donation through PayPal, you must have an active PayPal account in order for your transaction to go through. Thank you for your donations and support.

"The fall of dropping water wears away the stone."

Sincerely, 

Edie Hoyte

story:
Short Summary

My family, friends and I have been working with a Haitian couple who runs an orphanage, several schools and churches in various rural areas in Haiti since 2006. At that time, Marlaine and Daniel asked us to help provide medical care to the people living in these areas. I have grown to love this country and have many close friends there. I am a family medicine physician with a Master's degree in Health Behavior and Health Education. Eventually, I plan to transition my practice down to Haiti but for now, we take teams down to hike into these areas and set up mobile medical clinics. Our next trip is end of September into October for three weeks and we need help with medical supplies, including an ultrasound machine, and funding for interpreters.

More Specifics 

    The three places we will be setting up clinics this time around are Jacmel, Marbial and Gouneau. A couple of years ago, money was raised to build a small clinic at the orphanage in Jacmel. Its taken awhile to get this done but we're trying to open in September/October. We have limited equipment at this clinic and it would be incredible to be able to purchase a small ultrasound machine that we can also take up into the villages. This clinic will be open to the community. Ultimately, we'd also like to be able to run this by solar power but we'll work on that later... 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      The funds raised on this site will be used only for medical supplies and expenses directly related to providing interpreters for the trip. If you want to donate to a team members personal expenses then you can contact me (Jen) directly to figure out how. Our organization is a 501c3 and donations are tax deductible. Please share this link with anyone who may be able to help.

      Thank you so much!

story:
Did you know that 3D printers emit fumes and particles polluting the environment and harmful to health? And that the smells of plastic materials are unpleasant in our homes and offices?


Do you want your 3D printer to become a safer object?


That's why we invented KappaKit, the protective fume hood for your 3D printer.


Now you can stop worrying about 3D printer location. With KappaKit your printer can be integrated at home, in office, or in any other environment.

Enough with bad smells, enough with worrying about accidental damages to the printer, maybe while tidying the office




What is KappaKit, exactly? What's its use?

KappaKit is a fume hood equipped with an exhaust fan with an activated carbon filter that captures fumes, fine dust and odours, and at the same time protects your printer.

A hood for the makers - portable, practical, lightweight. Simple and clever, right?

Just place KappaKit on your 3D printer and printing at home or in any enclosed space will no longer be a problem.



KappaKit is an acrylic "box" that is placed on the 3D printer as a hood. The lower part is empty, so it can be easily placed on top of the printer or removed in a few seconds.


On the top side it is equipped with a fan and an activated carbon filter.
When the printer is in operation, simply activate the fan to filter smoke, particles, and odours.

Its body is completely transparent, so you can control how the printing job proceeds when the printer is in operation.

An easy-to-mount kit comprising:

  • 5 panels made of transparent acrylic;
  • 1 fan;
  • 1 activated carbon filter (+ 5 replacement filters);
  • Accessories for power supply (cables, connectors, etc.);
  • LED lighting.


Installation and Operation

KappaKit is very easy to install and use.
It consists of 5 acrylic panels that are snap-fit mounted and are fixed with small screws.

The fan and the activated carbon filter are fixed on the top panel.

A high-reliability fan. It can be on H24 without any risk of malfunctioning.

The power outlets are on the rear panel.
The 3D printer is connected to the power supply inside of the hood.

The external power cord provides power to all components of the hood: the printer, the fan, and the LEDs.

Before use, a single button switches on the suction fan, the LEDs and the printer.


In the final version of KappaKit:

  • there is an opening on each side that allows you to replace the filament or access the printer for any other operation;

                               


  • there are 3 separate buttons to activate the suction fan, the LEDs and the printer;

                                                      


  • the size is customizable depending on the printer model


KappaKit protects also your 3D printer against people, avoiding accidental damage.


With its fan and its activated carbon filter, KappaKit sucks particles. 

KappaKit sucks fumes away. No more unpleasant smells of melted plastic.

 KappaKit reduces the noise level of your printer when it is operating.


New model: Kappakit with tube

We have developed a new version of KappaKit: a model with a tube connected to the fan, that expels air directly to the outside.
This new version is specifically intended for those who don't ever want to change the filters and prefer carrying all fumes and dust directly outside.

Higher print quality

KappaKit creates a stable environment for the 3D printer in operation, with a constant internal temperature, and a protection against currents that can affect print quality by altering times of solidification of the extruded material.

                               


It integrates into the environment, making better use of space.

So you can make better use of the space all around, without worrying about how to place objects in the vicinity of the printer.

With KappaKit aesthetics is enhanced. Your printer 3D becomes more aesthetically pleasing.

With LED lighting, your printer is even more beautiful and functional, because it allows you to better control the creation of the objects when it is in operation.


Transparent or full colour

The standard version is transparent but you can request other colours to better integrate it to your environment. However, the front and back must be transparent in order to control the phases of printing and filament level of consumption.


KappaKit is available in many colours.


Art and Design

With the funds raised we also intend to work on the design of KappaKit, to make it a piece of furniture. The panels will indeed be printed and personalized with prints of photographs, artwork, or any decoration desired by the customer.


Specifications and Technical Characteristics

Standard version:

  • Composed by five panels: 4 side panels and an upper panel;
  • Acrylic panels: 5mm;
  • Dimensions: 19,7x 19,7x19,7 inches (50cm x 50cm x 50cm);
  • 1 opening on each side that allows you to replace the filament or access the printer for any other operation;
  • 3 separate buttons to activate the suction fan, the LEDs and the printer;
  • 1 external power connector;
  • LED lighting.

Customizable elements:

  • size, depending on the printer model;
  • colours.


Use of Funds

We will use the funds to:

  • Buy equipment to produce everything within our company;
  • Move from craft production to industrial production;
  • By industrializing the in-house production, we want to reduce the costs and the price for the customer;
  • Buy a machine for UV printing to print and customize the KappaKit panels with artworks, images, photographs and decorations of various kinds;
  • Experiment with other materials for the production.


What We Need

Our budget for the series production is 6,000 $, to be used for the purchase of equipment, components, materials, testing for future models with custom panels.


How You Can Help Us

Buy KappaKit! The purchase will be useful for both of us.
And if you cannot contribute money, spread the word and share this campaign with your friends.

Thanks so much for supporting KappaKit.


Shipping

International orders will require an additional contribution for shipping.
Please keep in mind that international shipping rates (including customs duties) are not the same for all the countries, that's why we have decided to give you the possibility to choose between two options:

1 - to add the following shipping costs during the campaign:
        EU: $20

        USA: $ 60

        All other countries: $120

      For this option we consider International Expedite Shipping (FedEx/DHL/etc.)

2 - to perfect the order in a second step, after the campaign, to value the best 
      solution for your needs. In this case the shipping costs will be paid separately
      and they will depend on your location and weight of the parcel (Choice
      Recommended).



FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions)


What size is KappaKit?

The standard size is 19,7x 19,7x19,7 inches (internal size: 19.69 x 19.09 x 19 inches). On website www.kappakit.com you can perfect the order by choosing  the size depending on your 3D printer model.

How many openings does KappaKit have?

It has an opening on each side that allows you to replace the filament or access the printer for any other operation.

Will be there a hole or notch for other cables (like a networkcable and/or an external filament)?

Yes, on demand we can make a hole or notch for other cables (like a networkcable and/or an external filament).
If you need more holes, it will be necessary to add an extra contribution.

How do you prevent depression?

The fan causes only a small depression, because KappaKit is not airtight: the lower part of KappaKit is opened, in this way the fan produces a small air flow moving from down to up. In order to increase this air flow, you just need to raise up a little bit KappaKit.
We have provided you with a 3D model of some supports that can be used to raise up KappaKit - 3D Model.

Maybe would it be better to blow the clean air into the housing to keep the temperature stable?

Yes in some cases, but not in others; it depends on several factors: structure of your 3D printer, type of filament material you use, etc.

Inside KappaKit you can control the temperature: by changing the height of some supports put at the four corners of KappaKit (we have released an stl file for printing them - 3D Model) you can increase or reduce the clean air flow coming in and consequently stabilize the temperature.



Can the fan speed be regulated by a motor control or something similar?

Yes, we have decided to use a 12V fan powered by the same power supply that powers LEDs. In this way it is easier to find or to build by yourself a speed regulator. For example you can use Arduino (or Raspberry, or Beaglebone, etc) together with a temperature sensor, to control the fan speed according to the temperature feedback you get.

operation.

Yes, on demand we can make a hole or notch for other cables (like a networkcable and/or an external filament). If you need more holes, it will be necessary to add an extra contribution.How do you prevent depression?
The fan causes only a small depression, because KappaKit is not airtight: the lower part of KappaKit is opened, in this way the fan produces a small air flow moving from down to up. In order to increase this air flow, you just need to raise up a little bit KappaKit.We have provided you with a 3D model of some supports that can be used to raise up KappaKit - 3D Model.Maybe would it be better to blow the clean air into the housing to keep the temperature stable?Yes in some cases, but not in others; it depends on several factors: structure of your 3D printer, type of filament material you use, etc.Inside KappaKit you can control the temperature: by changing the height of some supports put at the four corners of KappaKit (we have released an stl file for printing them - 3D Model) you can increase or reduce the clean air flow coming in and consequently stabilize the temperature.Can the fan speed be regulated by a motor control or something similar?
Yes, we have decided to use a 12V fan powered by the same power supply that powers LEDs. In this way it is easier to find or to build by yourself a speed regulator. For example you can use Arduino (or Raspberry, or Beaglebone, etc) together with a temperature sensor, to control the fan speed according to the temperature feedback you get.

story:
Introduction:

I am a man of 54 years old, a former biotechnologist, that turned later to web development. Now I want to use my acquired scientific, computer and social skills for this lobby campaign. Which I think is for the benefit of all mankind and not only for the elite. The idea behind this project is that aging of the human body is not considered a disease, but a normal process, has always been so, the way of the world, so since there is no disease there cannot be patents for cures, so the FDA says. But since there are now scientific insights for potential cures against the aging process, I want to lobby so that people think: OK there is a cure! So there must also be a disease (aging) pestering mankind! Lets tolerate longevity patented medication for everybody now!

There must come patents because otherwise no pharmaceutical company is going to do long term investments in research & development and marketing of longevity products, to protect their market and interests for lets say 20 years, the investments for such global marketed pharmaceuticals will be huge, however the potential profits are expected to be gargantuan.

I am a Christian and its my believe that this scientific potential eternal life concept has nothing to do with the religious Eternal Afterlife in Heaven, one can deserve by following Jesus example, even when you had have longevity in this life on Earth.    

Campaign description:

Lobby at the FDA

Lobby in scientific circles

Lobby at the pharmaceutical industries

Lobby in politics

Lobby in religions

Visiting institutions and congresses in person abroad, lobby by email, tweets and telephone.

Goal:

I hope this will bring the potential eternal life medication, for everybody affordable, during my lifetime. Moreover from Dutch death statistics one can conclude that with this potentially eternal life the estimated maximal life span is about 2,000 years before you die of "unnatural causes": A disease or accident etc.

Science:

I think that activating the promoter of the telomerase gene in every cell with gene therapy will do the trick. However I am open for criticism and suggestions for alternatives. But these kind of cures can not be patented in the USA, as I said before, because the FDA says: "Aging is not a disease!" But other medical experts say: "Cancer is not a fundamental problem anymore!". So I think this is true for all processes in the human cell. All that scientists need to do is gather and evaluate all information and turn that into a patented longevity medicine.

What we need & what you get:

I need funds to do the lobbying work and you get updates by blog on www.satoconor.com and by @galien8 daily tweets. And when I and my network succeeds also the affordable potential eternal life medication during your lifetime, delivered not by me directly but by your government and their medical institutions.

story:
More Patients Need Help Than We Can Serve

We're a small group of patients, Doctors and Caregivers support, safe, legal access for medical marijuana patients. 

  • The Hawaii Epilepsy Foundation estimates there are over 15,000 epilepsy patients in Hawaii.
  • You can support a patient for as little as $450. Your donation will license and support one new patient for six months. 
  • We need to serve more patients with conditions already proven to be treatable with medical cannabis. 
  • Your contribution will directly impact the number of patients we serve.

Our Background is in sustainability education. We've partnered with the County and State to create low-cost classes to help folks live more self-sufficiently. 

We're now applying what we learned to a small area of sustainable healthcare known as the Hawaii State Medical Marijuana Program. We are growing, processing and providing  licensed medical marijuana patients with safe, legal access to affordable medicine. Our operations are low cost and scalable. Our patients are replacing expensive pharmaceutical drugs. It's working. We just need your help to accept more patients. 


We Can't Grow Without You!

Your compassion truly makes a difference:

  • We need funding to scale our efforts to serve more patients. Our goal is to support 100 patients by the end of next year. In 2016 we hope to support 250 patients. This will create a big impact in our communities.
  • Your money will go directly into all organic growing materials (soil, fertilizers, pots, IMOs. ), energy efficiency measures and water for the plants.

Creating Impact with No Financial Opportunity

We are an All Volunteer Organization.

There is currently no legal way to obtain medical marijuana without growing and processing yourself or using a caregiver. Distribution may only occur between patient and caregiver. 

  • Providing safe, legal access to medical marijuana reduces the impact of other drugs in our community. When patients can get a steady supply from a single caregiver, they do not have to go to a drug dealer for pain relief. We want to shrink the black market while supporting patients with debilitating health conditions. We are essentially reducing health care costs for licensed patients and for everyone in Hawaii by reducing dependency on a government healthcare system.

A Financial Model to Help More Patients

The Hawaii Medical Marijuana Dispensary Task Force is putting together a program to allow dispensaries in Hawaii. We will apply for this program so we can expand the number of patients we can serve without external funding. 

Voters in Hawaii have supported and continue to support medical marijuana legislation. We will support as many licensed patients as possible. A dispensary model is expected in 2016. This will allow us to sell to licensed retailers and increase the number of plants we can grow without external funding. But we have to get to that point. Our current operation is sustainable but cannot grow without your help. 

  • We're doing everything out of pocket with volunteers.
  • Our monthly costs are prohibiting expansion.
  • Funding goes directly to capital improvements aimed at reducing operational costs. Volunteers will continue to do the hard work. 

Risks & Challenges

We have several risks inherent in our operation.

  • Fungus, mildew and too much rain. We've developed special formulations to control the mildew and fungus but they're expensive at around $50 per plant for organic sprays and IMO soil amendments. 
  • Our growing area is too small. Our plants need more space to be less susceptible to all plant disease. 
  • We currently have one 10x20 raised platform with plastic sheeting on metal frame roof). We need more dry area which requires more lights and more energy.
  • Our energy costs aren't that high. We maximize everything. But a really big risk is our generator. We've maxed out of watts! We can't add any more lights until we increase energy generation. Fuel, oil, gas treatment and parts are currently more than we can handle. We've learned how to take the generator apart and fix it it in the dark, in hurricanes at 3am but we just can't keep up with the costs. We desperately need a backup power generation system. We're remote and entirely off the grid. This is great for a lot of reasons but we need to go solar and use the generator for a backup rather than primary energy source.

story:
Hello friends, family, and kind strangers,

Let me start off by saying that I feel very uncomfortable asking for money, but unfortunately I have run out of other options. This summer I have secured an internship at a camp very near and dear to my heart, and it involves traveling to outreach programs in New Hampshire and Alaska. Because the camp is a nonprofit, they are unable to pay me, and I need help with travel expenses.

If you know me, you probably have heard me talk about Adam's Camp (adamscamp.org), an intensive therapy camp for children with autism, Down syndrome, cerebral palsy and other developmental disabilities. Way back when, my brother, Benjamin, went to Adam's Camp and I went as a sibling camper. As soon as I was old enough, I started volunteering there and haven't missed a summer since. I keep coming back because, as cheesy and idealistic as it sounds, working at Adam's Camp makes me feel like I'm making the world a better place. It makes me feel like my efforts, just a week of my time and dedication, can really make a difference in the life of a camper and their family. Sometimes I get to witness camper breakthroughs, and it's a really incredible feeling. 

This summer I have the opportunity to be the Adam's Camp Outreach Intern. Adam's Camp is based in Winter Park, Colorado, but has started three new  programs to spread its unique, interdisciplinary therapy model. These programs are in Alaska, New Hampshire, and Nantucket. As the Outreach Intern, my duties will include running volunteer orientations and supporting new volunteers, assisting in the creation of promotional videos, providing administrative support, and, most importantly, comparing camp processes between locations and recommending areas of improvement. I'll be working hard to make sure that camp runs as smoothly as possible now and in the future so that campers can, as the Adam's Camp logo says, realize their potentials.

I'm very excited for this work and am already involved in camp preparation. But I've reached a roadblock: my college did not approve my application for funding, and Adam's Camp Outreach does not have the funds to pay for my plane tickets to Alaska and New Hampshire. I've researched flight costs and, provided I purchase the tickets within the next few weeks, they will total about $1,200 (indiegogo charges 10%, hence my goal is $1,300).

The last thing I want to do is to ask my friends and family for financial support, but here I am. Adam's Camp means the world to me, and any contribution to get me there would mean the universe.

story:
Short Summary


East Bay Blues Sevens Rugby Club

Competing against the best rugby clubs in USA rugby, we are striving to win a national championship and give local East Bay athletes a stage to impress USA Eagles 7s selectors as they build a strong squad for the Rio 2016 Olympics.

We are unique in that we are a seven - a side only rugby club, representing the entire East Bay of San Francisco, California.

Our squad is made up from exciting college athletes returning home for the summer, men from NorCal 15 a side Division 1 clubs and rugby players who have learned the game at East Bay junior clubs like The Oakland Warthogs, Lamorinda and Danville.

We are raising money for our team uniform, training equipment, travel costs and tournament expenses for summer 2014.

Over 3 weekend tournaments in July we will play a series of frantic, high speed games only 14 minutes long to determine which rugby club represents NorCal in the National Championships.

We need your help.

(as a non profit, all donations are tax deductible.)



What We Need & What You Get


  • East Bay Blues Rugby jerseys with your company logo on the front.
  • East Bay Blues Shorts with your company logo on them.
  • A team tent for the 3 NorCal qualifier tournaments summer 2014 with your company logo.
  • 12 x Rugby balls with your company logo (6 for the East Bay Blues, 6 for one of our junior clubs) 
  • Hit shields and training equipment.
  • Hydration and recovery tools such as foam rollers, coolers etc
  • Travel expenses
  • Tournament expenses


  • Our gifts include: 
  • Website recognition (all supporters will have their name on our founding members website page)
  • Caps
  • T-shirts
  • Hoodies
  • Coffee Mugs
  • Pint Glasses
  • Rugby balls


The Impact

Funding our campaign will allow local, homegrown East Bay men the opportunity to play at the highest level of American rugby and showcase their skills for USA Eagles 7s selectors. 

The East Bay is full of passionate sports fans and we want to create a powerful club that represents you in NorCal and the National scene. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Come out and support the East Bays only mens 7s rugby club on tournament day. (check www.eastbayblues.com for schedule.)
  • Post our links to facebook and other social media. Spread the East Bay love!
  • Like our page on facebook
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!


East Bay All Day!


EIN 94 - 3289023

story:
A little bit about myself.

Hi my name is Jaye Ward and i am a 45yr old transgendered woman from Hackney in the east end of London in the UK. I am the parent of two incredibly wonderful and rounded girls aged 8 and 3 who, along with their mother have supported and still supoort me. I currently live with my mother, who has dementia, as i am her full time carer. i am nearing my 2nd year from transition and and currently under the care of the Charing Cross gender clinic in Hamersmith where i am on the pathway towards gender reassignment. I desperately need to have a number of Facial Feminzation (FFS) surgical procedures which are NOT covered by the UK's treasured National Health Service (NHS)

me and my girls

I have always worked my entire life (even when i was at university) and have contributed and still do to my community. 6yrs ago i started work as a support teacher and IT coordinator for a local primary school. It was at this wonderful school, where due to my gender dysphoria becoming to much to bare, i finally felt comfortable enough to transition. I was supported whole heartedly by the school, the parents and the children which helped me immensely. I would have stayed in this wonderful job, but my mother had already started to become ill and in January i had to leave the school to become my mum's full time carer as her needs had become severe and she needed full time care. i have gone from having a job to income support and a carers allowance and now cannot afford this incredibly important and life changing surgery.

my mum and my 3yr old Ava (best friends)


What is FFS?

 FFS is a series of surgical procedures carried out by specialist surgeons, where the structural damage caused by testosterone exposure are removed. in short, with the testosterone damage removed as much as possible a face with male features can be reshaped to be feminine. it isn't like cosmetic surgery, where a patients face will be made to look more aesthetically attractive, this surgery basically makes the patient resemble what they would look like if there hadn't been exposed to testosterone in the first place. this is very expensive surgery but i have done considerable research and have decided that i want to get this surgery done by the facial team in Marbella, Spain. I have had 2 consultations with the team and apart from their work being very very good, their after care is exceptional and their rates are very reasonable compared to the surgery being done here in the UK or in the US. Please check out their website for lots and lots of information on what FFS is and what they do, as they explain it FAR better than i do.

The above collage is FFS work carried out by the team marbella.

there is more example along with testimonials of their amazing work here at Jenny Bowman's sister site to the facial teams official website. her site can be found here.

What helping me get this surgery would mean to me.

I can't begin to explain what having this surgery means to me. but i will try. At my age any effects from hormone treatment are slow and subtle. being able to pass through the world and society safely and as naturally as a woman is very important to me. I am already incredibly comfortable within my new role but am very aware that my face does not equate with my identity and my gradually changing body. I want to contribute to the world through work and socially too. If i am always aware of the fact that my face still seems masculine then i know that any one else interacting with me will be thinking the same thing. This surgery means EVERYTHING to me. I will be able to live as a woman without looking over my shoulder so to speak. This surgery will enable me to live at my FULL potential finally. After 35+yrs of torment and hiding I can live true and happy..

i am trying to get the confidence together to make a video.. now that the campaign has gone live i'm hoping to add videos to let you all know how it's going.

As perks for helping me raise the funds needed i shall be making art work, exclusive t-shirts and vests, exclusive music selections from myself & friends and my daughters have asked if they can give an extra special thank you to everyone that donates in the form of a thank you drawing.

THIS IS EVERYTHING TO ME SO I REALLY HOPE YOU CAN HELP.

Thanks

JAYE

X
