Chris is rarely found without a book in hand and has an odd affinity for slathering butter on everything.
Justus Eapen is a software engineer obsessed with sexy code and healthy habits (and vice versa). He's a black belt in the dark arts of the stir fry and has been known to write killer bios in the third person. He loves sustainable farming and hip hop music. His name is a sentence, rendering it instantly memorable: Just use a pen!
Nicole Fallek is our rockstar designer who's the mastermind behind our fantastic graphics and photography. Her unique style and personality shines through in her work and makes her a truly invaluable member of the team. 
Adam Andrewjeski is a software engineer who likes hacking drones and taking them on long flights on the beach. He’s fascinated with cryptocurrencies, the dark web, and cyber security. You’ll probably find him reading up on personal development or blogging about his exploits with Swift and other languages at adamandrewjeski.com
Peter Dunbar is a former consultant turned Software Engineer with a passion for all things mobile and embedded. Peter’s addiction to problem solving has led him on a mission to bridge the gaps between the worlds of software and hardware. If you can’t find him working on our firmware, he’s probably off habit hacking in Ruby and Objective C.
Sasha Iuleu is a hardware superhero. He's managed to shrink the size of the Pavlok device considerably, making it discrete and easy to wear everyday. Sasha is responsible for the heart of Pavlok, the module. We're lucky to have such a hardworking and innovative thinker on our hardware team.


Where We Are
Pavlok is not just an idea. Pavlok has already begun shipping developer prototypes. Over 350 people have used the Pavlok app or system to form new habits.
We’ve utilized cutting edge 3D printing and electronics technology to bring you the most impactful behavioral change product to make a difference in your life.
With your support, we can bring behavioral change through the Pavlok worldwide. Your contribution will help fund:



Developing more awesome features!


Production


Fulfillment







FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Is the shock safe?
Absolutely! The circuit is complete on your skin, and the voltage / amperage is not enough to hurt you. It is a very noticeable shock --- like a static shock like when you walk with your socks on a rug and then touch a metal door knob.
Will Pavlok work on my Android and iOS?
Yes! We are developing both Android and iOS versions.
My mom thinks you guys are crazy.
Well that's not really a question but we understand, our moms think we're a little nuts as well but they love us anyway :)  
Are there other options besides shocking?
Beeping, vibrating, monetary penalties, and posting on your social network like Facebook. You choose what method motivates you the most. 
Do you offer a warranty?
Yes, Pavlok is has a one-year manufacturer warranty!
How long does the battery last?
Pavlok can deliver up to 200 shocks on a single charge. That means that for the typical user Pavlok will last 4 days on a full charge. 
What stops you from taking it off?
Pavlok knows when it's on you --- the human detect is an important component. If you're late to the gym, you get vibrated and shocked. But if you've made a real commitment, and you're not wearing the wristband --- you get charged money. Real commitment comes from real accountability.
Are there different size wristbands?
The wristband is adjustable, so it will fit you for sure :).
How do you control how much it shocks you?
You can adjust the intensity of the shock inside the app.
How do you charge it?
Pavlok charges through a Micro-USB cable which will be provided along with the device.
Can my device be controlled by someone else's phone?
If you give them permission to! But no, someone can't steal control of your device without your consent.
How much range does the device have with my phone?
The range of Bluetooth, which can be 40-60 feet.
Is the shock momentary or continuous?
Momentary.
How heavy is it?
It's very light --- a few ounces.
Is it difficult to set up?
Super easy! No previous rocket or scientist degree's required.
What kind of data does the app store about me?
At the moment, the app is not storing any data, but is using your current actions to deliver feedback.
How tight should the device fit?
Very snug to the skin to maintain constant contact to your skin.
Is it waterproof?
You can't swim in it, but we are working on making it highly water resistant.
What habits can I break with Pavlok?
Pavlok is designed to help to break ANY habit. This ranges from visiting distracting websites, going to fast food restaurants, not standing up from your desk often enough, going to bed late, biting your nails, and TONS of others. 
Do I have to wear Pavlok everyday in order to reap the benefits?
No! Research has shown that it can take as little as 30 days to break a habit. While some stubbornly ingrained habits can take up to 66 days, habits like flossing or going to bed on time can be achieved in less than 2 weeks! After you've formed a habit with Pavlok you no longer need to wear it everyday, unless you have a different habit that you are trying to make or break. And if you ever start to fall off track with one of your habits all you have to do is put Pavlok back on for a few days to correct yourself!
Are you guys the most awesome company ever?
Well it's very nice of you to ask :) We pride ourselves on our ability to give our supporters a truly unique device unlike anything they've ever had before and to give them the means to become the person they always knew they could become. Any awesomeness that we have is directly linked to the awesomeness of our supporters!
How does Pavlok know if I've completed the task?
Pavlok is paired with your phone using Bluetooth, and we use a variety of APIs to allow you to set goals you can't cheat. GPS will confirm if you're at the gym, for example.
Don't see your question above?
Shoot us an email at team@pavlok.com and one of us will get back to you quicker than a camel drinks a coke!

story:
Short Summary

The Gentle Healing Place Radio show has aired on Blogtalk radio for approximately 2 years with 75,000 listeners. We wish to graduate to a larger venue Contact Talk Radio Network which has a million listeners. Donations will pay for the 1st year we are on the air with this station.

What We Need & What You Get

Air time costs $350.00 a month and we will have a 1 hour show once a week and be able to spread our message of love, joy, and compassion.We are dedicate... d to facilitating personal growth, awareness and spirituality in the gentle way. We have a unique format with 3 psychics that do live readings .

The Impact

Your donations will go to pay the air time needed to broadcast our show on Contact Talk Radio Network. Every $350 recieved will pay for one month or 4 shows. We will be able to reach an international audience both on the internet as well as on the radio dial. CTR has over a million listeners.  We hope  to provide a safe place for people to come to discuss in forum fashion, non- traditional ways that lead to enlightenment and holistic health in a loving and positive way. Some topics may include psychic development,dreams,artistic endeavors,paranormal events and all things spiritual. The intention is to promote love in a real and practical way.Free readings are available on most shows from the Psychic Trio and Special Guests. It is our belief that the planet can be healed one person at a time by raising the potential and purpose of individuals to replace, power, profit, prestige to love, joy, and compassion for humanity. With purity of intention, anything is possible and we are open to recieving the gifts and blessings that the Universe intends for this vision.

Like this:

story:
Help our troops with back pain

My name is Paul Hagen, I'm the co-founder of VacuPractor, a Veteran owned small business (VOSB) with all the manufacturing done here in the U.S. For the last 3 years I have had a 95% success rate helping people with back pain feel better one back at a time.

With the military, these men and women need to be "Fit to Fight" and drug free. We currently have 3 military doctors using the VacuPractor with great success and we just completed a 6 week field test with the Army.

As a Sergeant in the U.S. Marine Corp from from 1987 to 1992 I had the honor of serving my Country at the U.S. Embassy, La Paz, Bolivia, the U.S. Mission to the United Nations, Geneva, Switzerland, and the U.S. Embassy, Paris, France. 

After my back stopped hurting, helping others with lower back pain became my calling.  It took us 5 years to get the patent, 1 year for FDA registration, and we have all the certifications and approvals to sell to the Government including our own Cage code.  We recently started making a few P-card sales too. 

Getting the VacuPractor into the hands of troops that are in pain, out in the field and those returning home is my latest mission.  There are too many, just popping pills. That is masking, not fixing the problem.

If you click this link it will open a new window and you can see our Military and Government information page along with our downloadble Capability Statement.  

We are a small company, that is competing against the giant corporations with $50 million dollar ad budgets for each new pill.  Please help us compete against Big Pharma, and support a 100% Made In America Company. 

How our simple invention works:

VacuPractor is a revolutionary patented device registered with the FDA for the self-treatment of lower back pain. The user lies on the device, creating a natural vacuum effect to gently pull the spine and stretch the muscles in the lower back area. Pain is relieved in as little as five to ten minutes of use. VacuPractor is a drug free solution and can be used on any flat firm surface with just a little water and it can be combined with other pain treatments as part of a patient’s total care.

What some of our users say:

I no longer use a lift insert in my one shoe, and my back does not hurt at the end of the day. Thanks VacuPractor

I have no problem recommending this product. I continue to use it almost daily. My back is soooooo much better due to THIS product. Blue Rules! Bev

I personally use and endorse the VacuPractor to all serious professionals who wish to reduce back pain and for core strengthening, specifically of the lumbar region. Art Sans - The Pain Eraser

At first I used my VacuPractor two or three times a week, I've cut that back to once a week or as needed. I’m 72 years old and am still able to weed my flower beds without having to run to the chiropractor. Deloris N.

 

Awards and Acolades

  • The National Veteran Owned Business Association (NaVOBA) awarded VacupPractor a one year gift membership on behalf of Northrop Grumman.
  • ZINO Life: Life Sciences Investment Forum "Best New Product" May 2011 $25,000
  • VacuPractor was approved by the National Certification Board for Therapeutic Massage & Bodywork (NCBTMB) as an  Approved Provider of continuing education. NCBTMB No. 451791-1
  • VacuPractor appeared on the influential health, wellness and human potential radio show hosted by Dr. Pat Baccili
  • Celebrity Fitness trainer Michael George endorses the VacuPractor
  • VacuPractor appears on MSNBC

What We Need & What You Get For Helping

We want to raise at least $48,000 and need your help to make it happen. We want to be able to compete with large drug companies and can not do that without additional funding..

We need a new mold to increase production, and lower our costs. The mold costs $15,000 and we want to produce the VacuPractor in 3 different sizes, small, medium and large instead of one size fits all which will increase effectiveness over the 95% mark. 

We need money to produce the VacuPractor in low visibiity colors like military green, camoflage and tan.

We want to continue funding our campaign meeting high ranking military doctors and clinics and placing units in their facilities for testing and evaluation.

We want to produce a high quality "Explainer" video that illustrates in simple to understand terms how effective and easy to use the VacuPractor is. These videos cost between $5,000 and $15,000.

Interested in helping out? Check this out!

How would you like the next color of VacuPractors named after you?

Back Pain is a major problem!

  • 31 Million Americans' backs hurt right now
  • Consumers spend almost the same amount (billions of dollars) on back pain as they do to treat cancer each year
  • Back pain is not just for the elderly; sixty percent of adolescents experience back pain by age 15
  • Low back pain is the second leading reason for missed workdays among employees under 45 

 

If you are unable to make a financial donation there are other ways to help!

Please share our campaign on social networks like Facebook, Twitter and Google Plus.

If you know anyone in the Military please tell them about our cause and see if they can get us a meeting on their base.

If you know any bloggers or journalists please ask them to feature a story about our campaign.

Thank you!

story:
MEET BIOMETRIX

BioMetrix is described by experts as "starting a shift in the paradigm of wearables" with our flexible, skin adhered, athletic form monitoring sensor.

BioMetrix is smaller, more versatile, less expensive, and easier to use than competitive systems

BioMetrix is dedicated to pioneering innovative AI for injury detection

BioMetrix is launching with sports medicine programs around the country this fall

BioMetrix is led by two  passionate former athletes and supported by a strong team of industry leading professionals and researchers.

BioMetrix could use your help. With your contribution or support as a beta user, you’ll help empower us to bring our solution to life faster and better. 


MEET OUR BioMX SENSOR

BioMX is a tool for medical professionals, experienced coaches and athletes with chronic injury or recovering from an injury

BioMX empowers users with unprecedented, feedback on changes in biomechanical indicators during rehab and PT routines

BioMX tracks performance and informs an athlete's progression through prevention and rehabilitation training

BioMX is a highly customizable, visual way to quantify and improve your rehab as easily as you quantify performance


FEATURES



PERKS


TIMELINE


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

We are releasing our team solution this fall but we could use your help to give it an upgrade and have a bigger impact on the athletes we serve. With your support we can:


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We are looking for supporters as well as beta users in the areas of Rehabilitation and Form Training. If you or someone you know is serious about training or coaching at the highest level, BioMetrix is here to help! In the mean time;

  • Spread the word about our campaign
  • Buy an extra perk for a friend
  • Introduce us to your team, program, or rehab center.
  • Keep in touch as we grow


MEET THE TEAM

story:
Jayden's story

Jayden was diagnosed with Childhood rhabdomyosarcoma, Rhabdomyosarcoma is usually curable in most children with localized disease who receive combined-modality therapy, with more than 70% surviving with proper treatment. Shelby, Jayden's mommy is 21 and devotes her life to Jayden and is confident that together they'll beat this. Jaydens chemo has yielded unsuccessful reulsts, he needs to travel back and fourth to Florida for radiation treatment. Jayden hasn't celebrated this first birthday yet.

Jayden needs money for travel and lodging. 

$10,000 is really not a lot of money when you're talking about a child's life and happiness. Jayden will need to make repeated trips from North Carolina to Jacksonville for his radiation treatments, mom will not be able to do this without your help. Help make a difference in in child's life who hasnt had the chance to really live yet. ALL money will go to Shelby and Jayden for his care and expenses regardless of goal completion. 

 

 

The Impact

Shelby is my niece, she has asked for prayers, I don't pray, I act. This is the best way I can see to help an amazing young women and her beautiful son. 

“Two hands working can do more than a thousand clasped in prayer."

-Madalyn Murray O'Hair

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money please help by posting this on your social network feeds, help us spread the word to get Jayden the funds he needs

story:
In just 2 minutes per day, you can use CorSense to achieve goals like:

  • improving physical performance (i.e. get faster, fitter, stronger)
  • managing stress and the hectic challenges of life
  • improving overall health and biological aging
  • enhancing mental performance at work, and fighting anxiety.

How can CorSense help you do this in such a short time? 

CorSense accurately and conveniently measures Heart Rate Variability (HRV), one of the most powerful biomarkers in use today (much more than just heart rate!). 

HRV provides a direct link to your nervous system - the main control center of your entire body and mind. 

By monitoring nervous system activity for 2 minutes each day, our adaptive and intelligent algorithms help you learn your individual stress and recovery patterns. 

When exercise, sleep, mental stress, and other lifestyle factors impact your patterns, we help you detect these changes and respond optimally to make progress towards your goals. 

Over time, this helps you build deep and actionable awareness of your body and mind. 

CorSense brings crucial HRV accuracy to this process (unlike most wearables), and the speed and convenience to fit into your routine (unlike chest straps and adhesives). 

 

Measuring HRV used to be expensive and inconvenient - limiting its use mainly to specialty clinics or big budget sports teams.

Now, capturing accurate HRV is simple:

 

HRV is NOT Heart Rate. 

Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is an accurate, non-invasive measure of the Autonomic Nervous System (ANS) - which responds to everything: how you exercise, recover, eat, sleep and perceive stress.

Unlike basic heart rate (HR) that counts the number of heartbeats per minute, HRV looks at the exact changes in time between successive heartbeats (also called inter-beat intervals or RR intervals).

The Autonomic Nervous System (ANS) consists of two branches:

 By trending short HRV readings on a daily basis, our adaptive algorithms help you learn what your "normal" ANS patterns look like, and then automatically guide you in improving those patterns over time.

 

Today, people use HRV to:

  • Improve resilience and adaptability 
  • Reduce stress 
  • Optimize training and recovery 
  • Personalize nutrition and sleep 
  • Improve mental health - mood, depression, anxiety 
  • Improve mental performance and cognition 
  • Identify risk of disease, morbidity and mortality 
  • Measure systemic inflammation 
  • Track progress and guide treatment plans 
  • Re-balance the nervous system with live biofeedback 
  • Objectively understand motivation and willpower 
  • Provide early warning signs for changes in health, overtraining or maladaptation

Now that you can accurately and conveniently track your nervous system, you can make better health, training, and recovery decisions to reach your goals. In the “Science” section below, we explore these topics further.

Here are a few real life, unedited stories from current users benefiting from HRV:

Dr. Dan Plews - Sport Scientist, High Performance Coach and Athlete - plewsandprof.com
 
Jan Taborsky - Entrepreneur and Runner - happycampersgf.com
 

Caroline Thomas - Health Coach and Personal Trainer

 

To learn more about using the power of HRV, read on to our "Science of HRV" section.

 

We designed CorSense from the ground up to capture accurate HRV, so the benefits of HRV would be more accessible and convenient.

Unfortunately many wrist wearables and smartwatches are not good at tracking accurate HRV. By contrast, CorSense is comparable in accuracy to a 5-lead EKG/ECG for HRV and pulse waveform, using multiple different LEDs, onboard algorithms and filters, fast sampling rates and physiologically optimized sensors.

 

We also designed CorSense to be a completely open platform. This means:

1) Raw data collected by CorSense is available for export/download; and

2) CorSense works with any open HRV app that offers Bluetooth connectivity - right out of the box.

However, for the full experience, we recommend using CorSense with the Elite HRV app.

 

With over 150,000 users from around the world, our app has been rated 4.5/5 stars on both Android and Apple.

Our users are health-seekers, doctors, wellness practitioners, coaches, athletes, sports teams, and researchers.

 

Here's an uncut demo of Jason taking his Morning Readiness HRV reading with the CorSense and the Elite HRV app.

 

The Team Dashboard is a premier tool for coaches, health practitioners, professionals, and researchers to analyze health and performance HRV data for their clients or members. 

 

Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is a unique biomarker! It is:

  • Comprehensive: it can track the physiological impact of exercise, diet, sleep and mental stress. 
  • Easy: It can be tracked non-invasively, in just 2 minutes per day. No need for 24/7 wearables, needles, blood or saliva samples!
  • Responsive: The impact of these stresses show up in HRV instantaneously and can give daily insight into your progress.
  • Individualized: Elite HRV tracks changes against your own baseline, not just against reference ranges or estimates from a general population. 

Steps, basic heart rate, and other simple markers just don't stack up, and other biomarkers are expensive, invasive, or inconvenient to measure.

HRV is the change in time between successive heartbeats (also called inter-beat intervals, R-R intervals, N-N intervals, etc.). Unlike basic heart rate (HR) that counts the number of heartbeats per minute, HRV looks much closer at the tiny, millisecond fluctuations that occur between each heart beat in response to internal and external events.

HRV is a direct link to your Autonomic Nervous System and can therefore be used to gain insights into your nervous system, overall stress load and capacity to recover.

Your Autonomic Nervous System (ANS) controls the unconscious bodily processes and influences the functions of internal organs. Some internal processes regulated by the ANS:

  • Heart rate 
  • Blood pressure 
  • Body temperature 
  • Electrolyte balance  
  • Digestion 
  • Respiratory rate 
  • Pupillary response 
  • Urination 
  • Sexual arousal

The ANS has two main branches: 

  • The Sympathetic Nervous System (SNS)
  • The Parasympathetic Nervous System (PSNS)

The Sympathetic Nervous System controls your body’s “fight or flight” reactions in response to internal or external stressors. It stimulates blood glucose (to fuel your muscles), pupil dilation (to see tigers better), slows digestion/peristalsis (to focus energy on the present danger), and increases heart rate (to ensure adequate blood circulation to run or fight). The SNS is ideally activated to overcome short term stress situations such as running from a tiger or fighting an intruder. But this same response also occurs when you exercise, perform challenging mental tasks, get into an argument, or even launch a new product :). 

The Parasympathetic Nervous System controls your body’s “rest and digest” responses and is associated with recovery. Parasympathetic activation conserves energy, constricts pupils, aids digestion, and slows heart rate. The PSNS is meant to help build for the long term and is needed to grow faster, stronger, and healthier. 

The SNS and PSNS control the same organs with opposite effects. Both branches are always working and both are needed to maintain homeostasis (balance or equilibrium) in your body. With every single heartbeat, your nervous system is saying “slow down – speed up” based on feedback from all your senses, emotions, etc. A healthy nervous system has a balanced but strong push and pull between the Sympathetic and Parasympathetic branches. Heart Rate Variability is an accurate, non-invasive measure of the ANS and the balance between the SNS and PSNS branches.

The Sympathetic Nervous System’s physiological response to stress focuses on short term survival in lieu of long term health. This acute response can become chronic (constant, long term) in the presence of stress from modern daily life such as work, relationships, financial, environmental, dietary, physical, lifestyle choices, etc. Chronically accumulated stress from multiple sources can all contribute to drastically reduced health and performance over the long term. 

A significant amount of research published over the past 50 years correlates Heart Rate Variability to: 

  • Disease risk and progression (diabetes, cardiovascular disease, respiratory diseases, gastrointestinal diseases, autoimmune conditions, etc.) 
  • Morbidity and mortality
  • Biological aging and health 
  • Mental health, mood, depression, anxiety, PTSD
  • Physical performance (HRV is heavily used in elite endurance and team sports to guide training and recovery)
  • Injury prevention
  • Guided rehabilitation
  • Mental cognition

Now that you can accurately and conveniently track your nervous system, you can make better health, training, and recovery decisions to reach your goals. 

Higher resting-state HRV scores signify the ability of the body to activate the Parasympathetic “rest-and-digest” response. Higher heart rate variability is correlated with: 

  • Increased fitness level 
  • Better health 
  • Better resilience 
  • Youthfulness 
  • Willpower 
  • Calm, positive emotions

Lower resting-state HRV scores signify an activated Sympathetic “fight-or-flight” response or suppressed Parasympathetic activity. This can indicate the body’s inability to engage recovery mode or an exhaustion of recovery capacity. This can be a temporary response to a previous day’s hard workout or poor night of sleep. Or this can be a chronic response to stress that results in reduced health and increased risk of disease. Lower resting-state HRV is tied to: 

  • Reduced fitness level 
  • Poor health
  • Increased disease risk and inflammation 
  • Increased biological age 
  • Negative emotions 
  • Increased anxiety and depression

Luckily, we make analyzing and understanding your HRV score easy. The app lets you tag your HRV measurements with the important things going on in your life and then helps you analysis the results and provides daily HRV-based guidance.

 

We are a small group that decided to leave our day-jobs and come together to make a difference. We are not a big company, but we are passionate about helping people reach their health and performance goals. We believe that heart rate variability is one of the most powerful tools available to achieve this. We value transparency and collaboration because everyone is smarter and better when honestly working together. 

 

A special thank-you to our collaborators!
story_txt:
In just 2 minutes per day, you can use CorSense to achieve goals like:
improving physical performance (i.e. get faster, fitter, stronger)
managing stress and the hectic challenges of life
improving overall health and biological aging
enhancing mental performance at work, and fighting anxiety.
How can CorSense help you do this in such a short time? CorSense accurately and conveniently measures Heart Rate Variability (HRV), one of the most powerful biomarkers in use today (much more than just heart rate!). HRV provides a direct link to your nervous system - the main control center of your entire body and mind. By monitoring nervous system activity for 2 minutes each day, our adaptive and intelligent algorithms help you learn your individual stress and recovery patterns. When exercise, sleep, mental stress, and other lifestyle factors impact your patterns, we help you detect these changes and respond optimally to make progress towards your goals. Over time, this helps you build deep and actionable awareness of your body and mind. CorSense brings crucial HRV accuracy to this process (unlike most wearables), and the speed and convenience to fit into your routine (unlike chest straps and adhesives).  Measuring HRV used to be expensive and inconvenient - limiting its use mainly to specialty clinics or big budget sports teams.Now, capturing accurate HRV is simple: HRV is NOT Heart Rate. Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is an accurate, non-invasive measure of the Autonomic Nervous System (ANS) - which responds to everything: how you exercise, recover, eat, sleep and perceive stress.Unlike basic heart rate (HR) that counts the number of heartbeats per minute, HRV looks at the exact changes in time between successive heartbeats (also called inter-beat intervals or RR intervals).The Autonomic Nervous System (ANS) consists of two branches: By trending short HRV readings on a daily basis, our adaptive algorithms help you learn what your "normal" ANS patterns look like, and then automatically guide you in improving those patterns over time. Today, people use HRV to:
Improve resilience and adaptability 
Reduce stress 
Optimize training and recovery 
Personalize nutrition and sleep 
Improve mental health - mood, depression, anxiety 
Improve mental performance and cognition 
Identify risk of disease, morbidity and mortality 
Measure systemic inflammation 
Track progress and guide treatment plans 
Re-balance the nervous system with live biofeedback 
Objectively understand motivation and willpower 
Provide early warning signs for changes in health, overtraining or maladaptation
Now that you can accurately and conveniently track your nervous system, you can make better health, training, and recovery decisions to reach your goals. In the “Science” section below, we explore these topics further.Here are a few real life, unedited stories from current users benefiting from HRV:Dr. Dan Plews - Sport Scientist, High Performance Coach and Athlete - plewsandprof.com Jan Taborsky - Entrepreneur and Runner - happycampersgf.com 

Caroline Thomas - Health Coach and Personal Trainer
 
To learn more about using the power of HRV, read on to our "Science of HRV" section. We designed CorSense from the ground up to capture accurate HRV, so the benefits of HRV would be more accessible and convenient.Unfortunately many wrist wearables and smartwatches are not good at tracking accurate HRV. By contrast, CorSense is comparable in accuracy to a 5-lead EKG/ECG for HRV and pulse waveform, using multiple different LEDs, onboard algorithms and filters, fast sampling rates and physiologically optimized sensors. We also designed CorSense to be a completely open platform. This means:1) Raw data collected by CorSense is available for export/download; and2) CorSense works with any open HRV app that offers Bluetooth connectivity - right out of the box.However, for the full experience, we recommend using CorSense with the Elite HRV app. With over 150,000 users from around the world, our app has been rated 4.5/5 stars on both Android and Apple.Our users are health-seekers, doctors, wellness practitioners, coaches, athletes, sports teams, and researchers. Here's an uncut demo of Jason taking his Morning Readiness HRV reading with the CorSense and the Elite HRV app.

 
The Team Dashboard is a premier tool for coaches, health practitioners, professionals, and researchers to analyze health and performance HRV data for their clients or members.  Heart Rate Variability (HRV) is a unique biomarker! It is:
Comprehensive: it can track the physiological impact of exercise, diet, sleep and mental stress. 
Easy: It can be tracked non-invasively, in just 2 minutes per day. No need for 24/7 wearables, needles, blood or saliva samples!
Responsive: The impact of these stresses show up in HRV instantaneously and can give daily insight into your progress.

story:
Voici mon cousin Joakim accompagné de sa femme et ses deux jeunes enfants. J'ai décidé de faire une levée de fonds pour les soutenir dans cette épreuve qui est difficile à plusieurs niveaux. 

- Étant donné que Joakim nous a quitté le 22 avril dernier, tous les fonds récoltés permettront d'apaiser certains soucis dans ce temps de deuil. Ainsi, les fonds seront versés à sa famille. 

This is my cousin Joakim with his wife and two young children. I decided to do this fundraising to support them during these hard times. As we know, cancer can create multiple difficulties. 

- Since Joakim has passed away on the 22nd of April all the funds we make will contribute to help his family financially so they can focus on being stronger during this time of grief. The funds will be given to his family.

The funds will be given to his family.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Mandy, and I'm hoping to raise at least 100 dollars by July 28th so I can go to summer camp! Any extra funds I recieve will go towards gas and lodging to drive there and camp next year!

What I Need & What You Get

I do not need the full 500, though it'd be nice. Indiegogo's minimum is 500, that's why I set it. I only need 100 to be able to make it to camp.

The Impact

NBTSC was the greatest and most wonderful experience of my life. It means the world to me that I get to go again, and see my friends again. I would be ever so grateful if you can help. Even 1 dollar helps. :)

Other Ways You Can Help

I know times are very tough, I totally understand. That's why I have to do this campaign. So even if you can't donate it'd be very nice of you to share this with friends and family and maybe ask them to donate or share it as well.

 

Thank you. :]

story:
Puli auf dem Mond

Es klingt schon verrückt, ich weiß. Aus Ungarn soll ein Rover zum Mond fliegen?

Team Puli Space arbeitet tatsächlich daran. Wir sind eines der 25 Teams im größten internationalen Preiswettbewerb der Geschichte. Der Google Lunar X PRIZE, gesponsert von Google, bietet insgesamt 30 Millionen Dollar Preisgelder für Teams, die bis 31.12.2015 einen Roboter zum Mond schicken, der dort mindestens 500 m zurücklegen, hochauflösende Bilder und Videos machen, und diese zur Erde zurückfunken soll. 

Das Besondere: die Teams müssen mindestens 90% privat finanziert werden.

In unserem Team sind viele jungen Menschen - Ingenieure, Wissenschaftler, Wirtschaftsexperten, Juristen, PR- und Marketing Leute -, die bereits über 20.000 Stunden in das Projekt gesteckt haben. Freiwillig und unentgeltlich, auf Kosten Ihrer Freizeit. Einige von uns haben sogar vieles aus eigener Tasche mitfinanziert.

Das Apollo Mondauto wurde unter der Leitung des ungarischen Ingenieurs Ferenc Pavlics entwickelt. Wir denken, es ist Zeit, wieder ein ungarisches Fahrzeug zum Mond zu bringen!

Wie könnt Ihr jetzt helfen?

Schritt für Schritt - das ist unser Credo bei Team Puli Space. Jeder Schritt, den wir schaffen, ist die Vorstufe für den Nächsten. Und mit jedem Schritt sind wir näher zum Mond.

Jetzt sind wir gerade dabei, unseren zweiten großen Schritt zu vervollständigen. Damit wird unser Prototype-System fertig sein, mit einem Rover-Prototpyen, einer Lander-Simulation, und Misson Control System. Wir nennen es liebevoll I2 - was für Iteration 2 steht.

Der I2 Puli wird im Oktober harte Feldtests in Ungarn absolvieren, und bereitet sich für einen Wüsteneinsatz in Marokko im Februar 2013 vor.

Er sieht nicht nur gut aus, sehen kann er auch schon ganz gut. Dennoch braucht er noch zusätzliche Augen. Und genau dabei brauchen wir Eure Unterstützung jetzt: sechs Firefly Kameras würden unser I2 System vervollständigen:
 
Alle, die uns unterstützen, werden Mitglied in unserem Kleiner Schritt Klub -  und der Puli wird alles tun, um Ihren Namen zum Mond zu bringen.

Auswirkung

Wir haben schon jetzt Beachtliches erreicht. Mit Eurer Hilfe können wir ein Stück Geschichte schreiben. Unabhängig davon, wie weit unser Puli kommen wird.

Ein Post von unserer Facebook-Seite: "Es ist Zeit zu zeigen, dass es möglich ist, die krankhafte Teilung (in Ungarn, Anm. der Redaktion) endlich zu überwinden, und zusammen etwas GROSSES zu bewerkstelligen!"

(Original: Itt az idő megmutatni, hogy a beteges megosztottságot végre át lehet hidalni, közösen egy NAGYOT cselekedni!")

Aus der Stellungnahme des Team Leaders:

"Wir möchten mit harter Arbeit, Ausdauer, Demut und ein bißchen Glück hoch fliegen, und hoffen, dass viele Ungarn in der Zukunft mit anderen Augen auf den Mond hinaufschauen werden."

"Kemény munkával, kitartással, alázatossággal, és egy csipetnyi szerencsével szeretnénk magasra szállni, és reméljük, hogy ezután számos magyar másként fog tekinteni a Holdra a jövőben."

Du kannst auch auf andere Weisen helfen

Einige von Euch können vielleicht nicht mit Geld helfen, aber das heißt nicht, dass Ihr uns nicht unterstützen könnt:

Erzählt einfach Euren Freunden und Bekannten von uns!

  • Puli Homepage und GLXP-Seite
  • Puli auf Facebook
  • Unsere Indiegogo-Kampagne

Und das war es schon. Zunächst.

Danke und Go Puli Go!

Puli Homepage und GLXP-Seite

story:
Hello, my name is Lindsey and I am a high schooler in Bellevue Washington. This project is important to me because I love helping others, and I also love passing the good spirit on.

My ultimate goal is $2,000 and that will provide a water source at a school in a 3rd world country. $1,000 will provide a share of a water source, but will not achive all of it. All money will be given to Save the Children, and extra money will be used to purchase things like goats and mosquito nets for familys.  The more money you give, the better the reward is. $30 gets you my family Sugar Cookie recipe, and $60 gets you the Sugar Cookie recipe and should-be-world-famous No-Bake Cookies. $100, the best, is rewarded with both of those, and a Chocolate Cupcake recipe!

The higher your contribution, the better the world is! More money makes more people happy and thankfull. If this project succeeds, I will do it again, except next time I will be raising money for educating girls all over the world.  But lets focus on what's important now, like raising money for clean water at schools. A major thing is that providing the water source makes sure no one near or in the school will ever get dehydratred, which makes it easier to function and learn!

Maybe you can't contribute. That doesn't  matter! You can still help! Tell your friends! Tell your co-workers! Tell everyone you know aboout this wonderful cause!

 

Thank you, and dont forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Lindsey

story:
Short Summary

See those girls in the profile pic, that's me on the left. My name is Rachel Robocker. I grew in in Maryville, TN. Now I live in Northwest Arkansas as a Graphic Designer with my husband and our baby boy.

Growing up, I didn't have many close friends. And of those close friends, most of them are gone and we have parted ways. When I was 6 years old, I was a skinny, blonde haired, innocent & quiet little girl. Afraid of most everyone and didn't want to do anything to get in trouble or be disliked. Too timid for my own good. But in first grade, I met someone who would change my life. She taught me to be strong, brave, and respect & love who I am. She showed me that sometimes you need to break a rule or two. She was with me through every hard thing I've ever dealt with in my life. She knows me probably better than I know myself.

Her name is Danielle Hubbard (she's the girl on the right in the picture). A strawberry blonde haired, freckled face little girl with a loud mouth and a lot of attitude. She wasn't afraid of anything or anyone. If she had something to say, she'd let you know. And she's my best friend still today (although the freckles have faded and her strawberry blonde is just blonde.)

It is honestly amazing we made it through our childhood without killing one another. Not from fighting. She's one person I rarely fought with. No, we were rough & stupid kids. The first summer together, we discovered what electric fences are the hard way (I don't recommend it to anyone), along with finding out what falling off your bike at full speed and landing like Charlie Brown feels like...I don't recommend that either.

We've been so tangled in brair patches we had to be cut out, rolled her go-kart multiple occasions, ran her Papaw's lawn mower into a barb wire fence (yea, it was destroyed) and lost in the Smoky Mountains back roads once we learned how to drive...and those are only a few of the things we'll admit too. Too sum it up, we've done a lot and hardly been hurt in our 24 years of age. Until last fall.

Danielle was told she had melanoma. Her first doctor didn't treat it as aggresivelly as he should, which we discovered in mid-March 2012 when she was told she has Kidney Cancer.

On June 1st, Danielle thought she may be having a heart attack. She drove herself to the ER (yes. HERSELF) at Blount Memorial in Maryville, TN. They told her it wasn't a heart attack. She had an aneurysm on her heart. Before she even had a chance to call her husband or father, they had her drugged and in an ambulance for UT Medical Center. (If you google map it, that's supposed to be a 21 minute drive...they did it in about 10). 

Danielle was in surgery for a very long time. Her surgery was a success and saved her life, but it wasn't an aneurysm like they had thought. It was a tumor. Her Kidney Cancer had moved to her blood stream and into her heart.

I received this news a couple days after she was home from the hospital (June 7th). I immediately left for TN to see her. I spent the weekend with her. Her arms look like a junkies from all the needles they had in her. Her chest has a 6 inch scar (healing nicely tho) and a few more scars from various needles and such. She was in good spirits, only complaining about her chest hurting. She said she didn't feel sick. She couldn't believe the cancer was real.

When I went back to AR for work on monday (June 11th), she called me. Her doctors had told her they gave her a 5% survival rate. We were shocked.

The doctors told her to go down to Tampa, FL. That they have an experimental treatment they can do. Her mother, her husband, her 3-year old daughter and herself packed up and flew down June 22nd, the earliest they could. It cost them $2100, not including the hotel, food, or rental car.

Monday, June 25th, the doctors at the Moffitt Cancer Center, told her there was nothing they could do. They had flown in for nothing.

June 26th, Tuesday, Danielle told me her urine wasn't right. She had called her doctor in TN. They said her kidneys may be failing. She flies up to TN Wednesday, June27th, for tests. If her kidneys are failing, they will keep in the hospital. If not, she flies back to Florida on Thursday to prepare for her wedding. She is planning on renewing her vows in Florida with her husband on July 8th. I am flying down the 6th to be with her on her 2nd wedding day. 

This is the only news we know so far. The chances of survival for Danielle are not good and things are getting worse. She needs some good news. And I want to help give that to her. If you could please help with the travel expense for her family and herself, I know it would mean the world to her! 

What We Need & What You Get

Any funs raised will go directly to Danielle's family for travel expense to hospitals. This includes plane tickets, possible hotel costs or rental car coverage.

When the goal is reached, I will tell Danielle about this donation site. I want this to be a surprise for her. If we don't meet our goal, I will surprise her with the amount we have raised at her wedding. Yes, this will be recorded for you all to see on the youtube channel.

The Impact

Danielle has received nothing but bad news. While I cannot give her good health news, you can help give her good financial news. Help her cover the cost of one of those round trip flights between hospitals! Help Danielle stay strong and brighten her day a little bit so she dosen't give up!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, please pray for Danielle Hubbard and her family. Spread the word about her situation. Prayer is a powerful thing and I believe the more prayers, the better.
story_txt:
Short Summary
See those girls in the profile pic, that's me on the left. My name is Rachel Robocker. I grew in in Maryville, TN. Now I live in Northwest Arkansas as a Graphic Designer with my husband and our baby boy.
Growing up, I didn't have many close friends. And of those close friends, most of them are gone and we have parted ways. When I was 6 years old, I was a skinny, blonde haired, innocent & quiet little girl. Afraid of most everyone and didn't want to do anything to get in trouble or be disliked. Too timid for my own good. But in first grade, I met someone who would change my life. She taught me to be strong, brave, and respect & love who I am. She showed me that sometimes you need to break a rule or two. She was with me through every hard thing I've ever dealt with in my life. She knows me probably better than I know myself.
Her name is Danielle Hubbard (she's the girl on the right in the picture). A strawberry blonde haired, freckled face little girl with a loud mouth and a lot of attitude. She wasn't afraid of anything or anyone. If she had something to say, she'd let you know. And she's my best friend still today (although the freckles have faded and her strawberry blonde is just blonde.)
It is honestly amazing we made it through our childhood without killing one another. Not from fighting. She's one person I rarely fought with. No, we were rough & stupid kids. The first summer together, we discovered what electric fences are the hard way (I don't recommend it to anyone), along with finding out what falling off your bike at full speed and landing like Charlie Brown feels like...I don't recommend that either.

story:
Hi, my name is Laura, I'm 41 years old and I have advanced breast cancer. I had a re-occurrence four years after my initial diagnosis 2008 and have been treated with chemotherapy, radiation and bilateral mastectomy. Recently I found out that my breast cancer has metastasized and is now in two locations of my bones.

I'm not worried about me, God's will is God's will and I accept that.
What worries me the most is my mom. I'm an only child and as such I knew that as my mom got older I would need to help her in many ways. But now she won't have anyone to help her once I'm gone. So, I'm here asking for your help. I'd like to raise money for my mother's needs after I'm gone.

My mom is a good person. She taught school in a poor part of town and would buy her student's clothes when they would wear the same thing three days a week, take them food during the holidays or when they started looking too skinny and help pay their electric bill when their parents couldn't afford to keep the heat on.

It will make it easier for me to go knowing that my mom has some money so she can take care of herself since I won't be able to.

Thank you,

Laura

story:
Help Noble Capital and Streamline Funding honor our Wounded Warriors


DALLAS, TX - On Monday, September 12th, Noble Capital and its subsidiary, Streamline Funding will sponsor the 6th Annual North Texas Wounded Warrior Golf Tournament being held at the Timarron Country Club in nearby Southlake, TX. The annual tournament benefits the North Texas Wounded Warrior Golf Association (NTWWGA) whose mission is to provide rehabilitative golfing experiences to the north Texas’ wounded warriors. At the tournament Noble Capital and Streamline Funding will be making a financial contribution to the NTWWGA with donations coming from some of its fundraising efforts leading up to the tournament.

 

The Noble Capital Golf Team

 

 

 


Golf tournaments are certainly not a rarity these days but ones with a good cause are and, as Jason Leap President of the North Texas Wounded Warriors Golf Association suggests, “In a time when businesses are so focused on just profits, it is nice to see companies like Noble Capital and Streamline Funding go out of their way to support an organization like ours.”

-Jason Leap

President of NTWWGA

 

“In addition to being a sponsor, we also wanted to try to do a little something extra… we raise money for real estate investment projects so why not put a little energy behind raising money for an organization we are also passionate about?” Noble Capital's Chief Marketing Officer, Romney Navarro. At the conclusion of the tournament both companies will present the NTWWGA with its donation from its fundraising efforts and pledge to supplement the donation by matching part of the total funds raised.

-Romney Navarro

Noble Capital Chief Marketing Officer

 

 

Check out our awesome "Perks"

 

Texas vs. UTEP, Sep 10th

 

Private Label Noble Capital Cigars

 

Custom Putter Covers

 

Lunch with the Warriors

 

Team Lake Jump - If we reach $5,000 Funding Goal

The Noble Capital Golf Team (Tammie Tirres, Ericka Luddy, Jenn Lewis) and NTWWGA President Jason Leap will jump into the lake on Hole #18 following the tournament if we reach our $5,000 target funding goal.

 

Streamline Funding is a private lending organization who specializes in providing financing to real estate investors across the state of Texas for new home builds and remodels. Noble Capital specializes in placing privately raised capital from high net worth individuals, family offices and retirement plans into the projects that are originated and underwritten by Streamline Funding. For more information on either company please visit, www.streamlinefunding.com or www.noblecapital.com.

story:
My name is Clarissa and I'm a mother on a mission to raise awareness about reversing liver disease (amongst other diseases) through intent and action.

I have several family members who suffer from disease including my father who passed away at the age of 33 from a massive coronary, my mother who also suffers from heart disease, and my grandmother who had kidney cancer resulting in the removal of one of her organs, which has caused her several other health problems resulting in close to 20 surgeries.  I once suffered with disease, but have reversed my sickness and because of that I want to share my solutions with others. It is imperative to me to spare others the suffering that I had to endure. My struggle spanned half a decade in which I suffered from nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (fatty liver disease), menorrhagia, obesity, and several other underlying conditions; these devastating diseases are dangerously common in our society. I however did not allow the diseases to beat me down. I found the courage to make changes in my life to save it. These changes are backed by modern research and the results I experienced are jaw-dropping. Not only did I stop the disease, I have also initiated the process of reversal and have improved the quality of my life immensely. With just a few lifestyle and diet changes my world changed from giving me a life of agony, being a victim of disease, to giving me a life full of wonderful hope and triumphs. (You can read my full story HERE)
The common occurrence of these diseases in our modern society has already led to the pharmaceutical industry gearing up and attempting to crush natural remedies that won’t profit them. The pharmaceutical industry has an extremely large budget and will ruthlessly use it to further their cause while force-feeding us the lie that we need their pills to get better.
Our common knowledge on nutrition is confusing at best with experts having contradicting findings, while our family, friends, and neighbours sink deeper into the spiral of obesity and disease.

Purpose & Vision

The purpose of this campaign is to fund the education and assistance of those suffering from disease and other conditions that result from it, so that they can make changes in their lives. Just a few small changes can turn a miserable existence into a life full of joy and happiness.
Everybody knows someone who is either affected by liver disease and related diseases or is affected personally(you may have liver disease and not even know it; most don't know until the condition has worsened greatly). Your contribution will help your friends and family find an affordable way to live a healthier life and reverse theses diseases. By helping the sick you are helping the most vulnerable in our society and enable them to create a better life for themselves and their families. Our purpose is to help those affected by disease personally and in one on one sessions at no cost to them. Instead of burdening the sick more and intensifying the poverty that is the result of illness, we are planning on offering easy access to our services at no charge for the affected, so that they can focus on regaining their strength and being triumphant over the disease.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to reach them and supply them with free educational materials, free tools, free resources, and in order to host educational events, our funding goal is $1,000,000. Contribute today and help us help you and your loved ones. If you decide to contribute you will also receive a gift in remembrance of your service to everyone suffering.
Our sick and poor need this change. America needs this change. We need to do something about the disease epidemic now, so that we can all live healthier lives. Help us help you accomplish your goals for your body and help those who you know that are affected. With simple intent and actions: this is 100% possible!
You are the key. You can make a change. You can give others a chance. You matter.
Your contribution will change the life of an illness stricken family for the better.
You can contribute and you can tell others to do the same. Give everybody you know a chance to be part of this great project.
Let’s make this a challenge to follow up on. Let us all stand together for the health of our nation and show that America is not the land of the sick, but the land of the free. Let us free ourselves from the chains of disease that we have forged over the past few decades. Let us all stand together and say that we have the power to do something about this. We are America.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetary funds... we ask that you spread the word and make some noise about this campaign. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Problem

This new balm is a natural, plant based product which is applied directly to the tummy whilst you're in the throws of cramps. It uses relaxing essential oils: mint, marjoram and cypress with castor oil, shea butter and coconut oil to give a velvety texture. 

Created by a medical herbalist who has over 10 years experience helping people suffering with period pain. Including her own. 

Stage

The product is at the prototype stage. It needs to be licensed before stock can be purchased and the initial batches manufactured. 

Why this matters to me

I spent years suffering with debilitating period pain. Always fearful of when my period would begin because once it did I'd be clutching at my stomach, green faced and unable to work. I didn't want to take pain killers for the foreseeable future. I wanted natural options which addressed the cause of the problem: stress + constriction. So many women suffer on in pain, told that's what to expect for their sex. But I think we should strive for better. There are non-toxic, eco-friendly, natural options out there which need to be made available to everyone! 

Before I can bring this product to market I need to have the product tested for its sell-by date, then buy the packaging to begin manufacturing. Most women don't even realise it's possible to improve problems like period pain so I need to create a marketing plan which helps to spread the word as much as possible! 

I already make a range of products which help menstruators nourish themselves. All of these are being offered as rewards for your support. 

Everything listed as rewards cost more on indiegogo than they do on my website. This is because I assume you want to add a donation on top of your purchase! It's the only way I can raise funds in a time-efficient way. 

TARGET 1. £150 Licensing

Getting a license is required for each product applied to the body in the UK. I can't sell to the general public without one. 

TARGET 2. £400 Packaging

By hitting this mark I'll be able to get the stock I will need to actually produce the products which the licenses are for. Without reaching this I won't be able to invest in making the initial stock. 

TARGET 3. £1400 Get the word out

In the past, I have struggled to get the word out about the help I can provide. With this money I'll be able to work with professionals to ensure the balm is seen in national newspapers.

story:
Equine therapy: Building healing, self-confidence and trust on horseback

Many volunteers support Happy Trails Riding Academy so that more children, Wounded Warriors and adults can experience the life-changing opportunity that is equine therapy.

Volunteers and staff work with children and adults with physical, cognitive and emotional disabilities such as cerebral palsy, ADHD, head trauma, PTSD, autism, Down syndrome and more. They are paired with horses in a challenging alternative to traditional therapy, which results in healing, trust, independence and improved communication.

Happy Trails is a PATH International premier accredited center – a symbol of excellence.

Hay! Happy Trails needs a barn!

Our 18 horses will go through 50 TONS of hay in 2015 and we have no hay barn. The hay is now being moved daily from a local farm but we need a hay barn on site large enough to accommodate storage of a lot of hay.

Of course the need doesn’t stop there. We must continually fund-raise to pay for the care of the horses and the facility and staffing. Your donation will support all aspects of our mission.

How does equine therapy work?

We provide therapy to about 80 kids and adults a week, ranging from 3 to 50+ with the majority under age 18. Equine Assisted Activities and Therapy uses the horse’s dynamic movement to improve the trunk mobility and strength, which then affects limb function. The horse provides a consistent and rhythmic movement pattern that facilitates treatment goals, which is crucial to the student’s success. The therapist, volunteers, horse and rider form the therapy team.

Equine Services for Heroes is the newest program. In conjunction with the Wounded Warrior Project, Happy Trails provides therapeutic horsemanship to help veterans deal with anything from physical injury to PTSD. It has been proven to help strengthen them physically, mentally and emotionally.

What is Happy Trails Riding Academy?

Our vision is to operate an attractive and quality therapeutic riding facility on our own property, with outstanding, modern facilities in a safe, secure and caring environment. We will we have the best horses possible to meet our program needs and will make sure they are properly treated and cared for. We are committed to expanding our facilities, if financial resources are available, to meet our growth needs. Tack and related equipment will continually be inspected and upgraded to make sure they are safe as possible for our ridership.

How does equine therapy work?
We provide therapy to about 80 kids and adults a week,
ranging from 3 to 50+ with the majority under age 18. Equine Assisted Activities
and Therapy uses the horse’s dynamic movement to improve the trunk mobility and
strength, which then affects limb function. The horse provides a consistent and
rhythmic movement pattern that facilitates treatment goals, which is crucial to
the student’s success. The therapist, volunteers, horse and rider form the
therapy team. 
Equine Services for Heroes is the newest program. In
conjunction with the Wounded Warrior Project, Happy Trails provides therapeutic
horsemanship to help veterans deal with anything from physical injury to PTSD.
It has been proven to help strengthen them physically, mentally and
emotionally. 
What is Happy Trails Riding Academy?
Our vision is to operate an attractive and quality therapeutic
riding facility on our own property, with outstanding, modern
facilities in a safe, secure and caring environment. We will we have the best
horses possible to meet our program needs and will make sure they are properly
treated and cared for. We are committed to expanding our facilities, if
financial resources are available, to meet our growth needs. Tack and related
equipment will continually be inspected and upgraded to make sure they are safe
as possible for our ridership.

story:
Thanks everyone for your support and interest in this project!  We filmed in January 2014 and are currently in post production.  Click here to receive updates about the release of Restore Your Core. 

Read all about the program below!

For additional questions regarding private sessions, distribution partnerships, investment opportunities or otherwise, contact Lara directly through her website:  laracatone.com.


Project Summary

I have been studying the relationship between movement and the childbearing period for eight years.  A number of years ago I noticed that too many postpartum women were suffering from exhaustion, back pain, leaky bladders, pelvic pain, weak abdominals and lack of intimacy with their partners.


I saw many women who were struggling with the consequences of diastasis recti--a common condition among postpartum women where the abdominals separate. I realized that a conversation about diastasis was largely missing among my yoga and childbirth education communities.  I also realized doctors didn't seem to have answers either. 

 

I was so tired of women being told "that's just what happens when you have a baby."  It didn't add up that women should accept pain and dissatisfaction with their bodies as a reality. I received so much conflicting information about how postpartum women should exercise that I decided to get to the bottom of it all.


In 2011 I began development of the Restore Your Core program which includes nonsurgical approaches to diastasis recti (abdominal separation) and pelvic pain and dysfunction. 

Every day I receive requests from women around the world searching for better resources for their postpartum healing.  I am answering this call by making my Restore Your Core program available online and on DVD.  This indiegogo campaign will allow me to film the first ever comprehensive yoga based healing program for moms!

My program is unique.  It addresses the whole body and whole being. In my functional approach I include breath and relaxation practices, alignment, strength and flexibility training as well as sensual feminine movement.  Although the focus of this program is for moms it can help women in all stages of life.

Learn more about Lara at laracatone.com.

What Will the Funds Be Used For?

I am seeking $7,500 for:

-filming & production costs
-graphic design
-business start up & legal fees

What If You Make More Than Your Goal?

That would be amazing!  We are currently raising funds for the production of this video, it does not include the costs of editing, marketing, PR, building the online platform etc.  Phase Two of our plan will be to seek investors for the new company we are launching to bring this program to the world.  Any additional funds would be funneled into post production of the project.

Tell Me More About the Restore Your Core Video

The RYC video starts with practices for healthy breathing and alignment that can apply to all areas of your life.  How we breathe, sit and stand has great influence on the abdominals and pelvic floor. There is an education section all about diastasis recti and how to know if you have it. You will receive several yoga based fitness routines that progress as you get stronger. I also include sensual feminine movement that is more circular and free while still strengthening your core.  Women's bodies like to move in curves!  Finally, there will be bonus information on topics like nutrition, sexual health, healing birth related scars and what to do about stretched-out skin. 


Previous yoga experience is not necessary, this is an all levels program.  If you are a seasoned yogini, RYC will guide you in deepening your practice in a way that is truly safe and supportive. RYC is not just for moms. If you haven't yet had a baby this video is great preparation for maintaining a healthy core throughout pregnancy. If you are a woman well beyond the childbearing years, RYC can support you in changes to your muscle tone that come with aging. Women in every stage of life can benefit from learning how to leverage their core power.  

How Did You Come to Develop this Program?

I am passionate about making a positive impact in the world through the empowerment of women. My mission is to inspire this through revolutionary education, radiant health and pleasure. 

My career path as a yoga teacher, doula and sexual wellness educator has led me to helping women solve core issues related to pregnancy and childbirth.  

I am a scientist by nature.  I love research, learning and understanding how things work--especially in the human body.  This investigation also brought me to a much deeper understanding of how all of the parts of the core work together including the pelvic floor.  I have spoken to yoga therapists, physical therapists, chiropractors, bodyworkers, midwives and worked with many, many moms.  I have also looked at a variety of exercise modalities.  I continue to investigate and learn more each day.    

The Impact

Your contribution provides an opportunity to make a big difference in women's holistic wellness and healing.  The postpartum core is not very well understood by the medical community or fitness professionals.  We will be educating many people on the safest and most effective ways to connect mamas back to their core strength and power.

Testimonials




Other Ways You Can Support

We appreciate all kinds of love!  Here are some other ways you can be involved:

1.  Spread the word on social media!  Use the share tools on the top of the page and connect with Lara on Facebook & Twitter.  

2.  Tell all of your mama friends who desire to feel stronger and healthier in their bodies.

3.  Share with your audience on your blog, podcast, in your newsletter or other media outlets.  Lara loves to do interviews and share her wisdom about core health for moms.

4.  Hold this vision with us and send us some good mojo for success!

5.  Want to help us take our business to the next level?  Consider becoming an investor.  For more information contact Lara.

Stay in touch!  Sign up here.

Super Special Thanks

INDIEGOGO SPONSORS - for providing amazing perks!

Hillary Branoff 

Hillary is most passionate about soothing the nervous system with Ayurvedic body therapies as well as the transformational detoxification process of Pancha Karma. She is an advocate of self-love through nourishing foods, rest, nature, and laughter.


   Joanne Ameya Cohen

Joanne Ameya Cohen is an Expert Herbalist, inspirational speaker, Feminine Empowerment Mentor, and author of “The Healthy Feminine Leader: Alleviate Stress, Balance Your Hormones, and Tap Into Your Power”.


  Spa Sophia

A boutique spa located on Abbot Kinney in Venice Beach. All of our estheticians bring an extensive understanding of skin, products, and health creating a holistic approach to skin care. You will leave your session feeling de-stressed, renewed and truly taken care of. 

MY COLLEAGUES - for your kind words and continuous support & inspiration

Dr. Elliot Berlin - Berlin Wellness Group
A highly specialized team of doctors, therapists and practitioners of pregnancy specific chiropractic, massage, acupuncture, individual and couples counseling, yoga, craniosacral therapy and lactation support.

Beth Cannon - Birthing Rhythm Midwifery
Attending home births and offering individualized midwifery care tailored to meet the unique needs of your family.

Wendy Obstler - Divine Spark Yoga 
Los Angeles-based certified yoga therapist, pre & post-natal yoga instructor, as well as the certified Lead Teacher and Ambassador of Strong Yoga®4Women. 

MY ONGOING COLLABORATORS & SUPPORTERS:  Queen of Hearts Clothing, BlueSpark Studios, Shivers Films. 

Core Resources

Why Sex Hurts & What You Can Do

3 Ways to Check for Diastasis Recti - It’s Not Just About the Space

Better Sex After Baby 

Is Diastasis Affecting Your Sex Life?

Sticky Situation:  What Scars You Can't See Are Doing to Your Body

Questions?

If you want to know more about how Indiegogo works, see their FAQ page.
