story:
WE ARE SHIPPING NOW! Scroll to the bottom of the campaign to see our inventory and packaging process! All backers will receive their rewards in June.

At-home vision testing, powered by your smartphone. 

  • Check your eyes whenever, wherever
  • Measure your pupillary distance (PD) 
  • Order glasses online with your results 
  • Track your vision with personalized reports

EyeQue VisionCheck is a refractometer that measures your refractive error, i.e. your nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism. The tests show results in the same format as your prescription, allowing you to order glasses online. 

The results will also include your estimated near-vision add (NV ADD+), needed to purchase reading or progressive glasses.

The VisionCheck includes a patent-pending pupillary distance (PD) measurement tool, called the PDCheck, that accurately captures your PD in a matter of seconds.  

We've given over ONE THOUSAND demos of the VisionCheck over the course of 4 days. Check out what people are saying!

 

 

EyeQue Provides Award-winning Consumer Technology 

The EyeQue VisionCheck's development is based on our first product, the EyeQue Personal Vision Tracker, a manual refractometer that launched on Kickstarter and Indiegogo in 2017. Having received over 4500 pledges, our technology was also nominated for the prestigious SPIE Prism award; referred to as the Oscars of the optical industry.

Over the past two years, our patented technology has shown unprecedented accuracy and received praises from many of our users. Check out our testimonial section below!

CES has honored us with not one, but TWO CES Innovations Awards in 2017 and 2019. 

Save money: The EyeQue VisionCheck is inexpensive (MSRP $59.99) compared to your typical office visit and can be shared with many persons. All of our products are supported through annual memberships, currently starting at $4.99 per year. Each membership enables unlimited usage of all EyeQue vision-testing products, ranging from $29.99 to $89.99. 

Save time: Unlike traditional office visits that you make once a year, you can use the EyeQue VisionCheck anywhere, anytime. All you need is a smartphone and an active internet connection. No need to schedule ahead, drive through traffic, and wait at the office only to sit through boring lectures or sales spiels. In comparison, each VisionCheck test takes about 5 minutes to complete once you understand the process. Most first-time users get great results after taking 3 or 4 tests, usually under 30 minutes in total. EyeQue is hassle free and gives back hours of your valuable time.

More accurate than a single point-in-time refraction test: Since your vision fluctuates throughout the day, taking multiple tests at different times of the day gives a better average refraction than a one-time refraction test during an office visit. Especially if someone is having a bad day! The MIT-patented technology powering the VisionCheck has been extensively tested with over 12,000 users over the past 2 years and has been optimized to give excellent refraction values for ordering eyeglasses.   

Real tests, real results: Unlike other online vision tests, VisionCheck gives you a true refraction measurement. These results are called "EyeGlass Numbers" (EGNs). We do not simply request and renew your prescription. EyeQue products ACTUALLY test your vision and generate real scientific results. Also, there's no wait time; you get refraction results (EGNs) immediately after you complete three refraction tests.  

See your data, use your data: Your personalized dashboard can be accessed through your EyeQue account and contains a multitude of information about your vision. This includes detailed reports showing and explaining your results, as well as the consistency of your testing. The report even compares your vision results with the general EyeQue population! Use your most updated EyeGlass Numbers (EGNs) to order glasses online from trusted retailers or share them with your eye care provider.

Safe & robust: VisionCheck uses only the illumination from your smartphone screen, filtering the light making it completely safe for your eyes. The VisionCheck device is rugged yet beautifully designed. Internal elements of the device are enclosed in a solid injection molded plastic housing while the precision optics are made from the highest grade polymers; the electronic components are commercially approved as well. VisionCheck has undergone extensive environmental testing including drop, temperature, humidity, and shock tests to ensure that it is safe and robust enough for household use. VisionCheck is registered with the FDA as well.         

                   

Fun and easy to use: Simply launch the app, attach the VisionCheck device, and use the touch sensor buttons to perform a series of game-like actions to overlap the red and green lines as you look through the device. Voila, you get your refraction results in the form of EyeGlass Numbers, instantly. Voice guidance is also available, making it even easier to use. 

Seriously amazing support: Our success is based on your satisfaction, and we are committed to providing responsive solutions to meet your needs. Some of our members have described us as obsessively customer focused, a compliment that makes us smile. Typically, we respond to any email requests within 24 hours. We also have an online chat service to work through any issue you may be having. Our support staff are in-house professionals that work closely with our software and optical engineers. We also have an extensive database of educational content on vision and health, called "Knowledge Center", which can be accessed on our website anytime.

We are mindful of your privacy and security. We use HIPAA compliant processes and cloud storage for all your EGNs and personal data. We do not share your information with any organizations for any purposes, EVER.

What's inside?

Below is an “exploded view” of the patented VisionCheck device. It is a precision optical instrument built with micron-level tolerances. Substantial engineering effort was required in order to build reliable devices on a mass scale. To achieve that, we have employed a team of exceptional industrial designers, mechanical, electrical, optical, and firmware engineers. 

How it works:

The VisionCheck is based on an MIT patented technology licensed exclusively to EyeQue. This technology has been extensively tested in our 1st generation product, the Personal Vision Tracker and uses a variant of the inverse Shack-Hartmann effect. 

The device projects two parallel beams of light that comes from the smartphone display into your eyes and onto your retina. The beams of light come from red and green lines formed by illuminated pixels on your smartphone, separated by 2.5 mm when they leave the device so that they can fit through your pupil.

Using an interactive touch-sensitive interface, the user overlaps the two lines to form what looks like one yellow line. Based on the amount of pixel movement made, EyeQue calculates the user's refractive error in that particular direction. The device then rotates the lines to another angle and you repeat the measurement. Measuring the refractive power over a number of different angles gives the sphere, cylinder, and axis needed to correct your vision with eyeglasses. The method works for most people who are willing and able to follow the instructions we provide.

The science behind the device:

We cannot explain the science without explaining the human eye first. Nearsightedness, farsightedness and astigmatism occur when the eye lens and eye distance are “out of synch". Normal distance vision is the result of the light entering the eye and focusing exactly on the retina, where the brain interprets sharp images. Common deviations from normal vision, nearsightedness, or myopia, occurs when the lens focuses the light before your retina; Farsightedness, or hyperopia, occurs when the lens focuses the light past your retina, both causing the brain to interpret "blurry" images. Almost 50% of the human population has some degree of nearsightedness, farsightedness, or astigmatism. These conditions are also known as "refractive errors".

The EyeQue VisionCheck is an optical device that achieves the effect of a variable corrective lens as it translates pixel spacing on the smartphone screen to corrective powers. To simulate the effect of converging or diverging rays into your eye that a correction lens would provide, you simply move the pixels on the screen closer or further emulating the effect of a corrective lens; overlapping the red and green lines and creating a single yellow line. Think of the VisionCheck as a custom converter of pixel spacing to optical power. Using that conversion, VisionCheck can determine corrections from + 8 D to – 10 D.

VisionCheck uses your smartphone's display to work; with a pixel spacing on the order of .07 mm (70 microns) or better– comparatively, about the diameter of a human hair. VisionCheck works well for phones down to 250 Pixels per inch (PPI). Any PPI below 250 means that the resolution is too low for it to be optometrically accurate.

The iPhone6s, for example, has an adjacent pixel spacing of 21 microns, and about 63 microns between same color pixels. With this small pixel spacing, VisionCheck exceeds 0.25 Diopter resolution. As a reference,0.25 Diopter accuracy is the level typically achieved by Optometrists.

While it is easy to understand how EyeQue can measure the overall optical power for nearsightedness and farsightedness, VisionCheck also gets an accurate measurement of astigmatism by sampling over different angels. To measure astigmatism, a complete set of power measurements is comprised of 9 measurements for your right eye and 9 measurements for your left eye. Measurements are made at increments of 40 degrees and with these measurements, the astigmatism is computed.

Yes, that’s a lot of measurements but the device is making measurements of tiny differences that reflect the shape of the eye lens and cornea. About 1 diopter of astigmatism, a typical value implies that the non-spherical component of the eye is about 0.25 mm. 0.25mm is thinner than your average ball-point pen point.

All computations are carried out in the EyeQue cloud as it takes a substantial amount of computation that is dependent on many different parameters including the smartphone you are using. As you take more tests, the results are aggregated together through averaging and removing bad data points. Each test is scored based on the goodness of the computed fit to the measurements. An example of test results is shown below.

Along with your test results, we also provide you with a measure of the consistency. The plot on the right also shows how other users have performed as shown by the relative size of the blue dots; most but not all users fall into the "good" category. Our personalized vision report is a great way to stay in touch with your test results and vision changes.

PDCheck:

VisionCheck includes another cool test called PDCheck™. Accurate measurement of pupillary distance, PD, is necessary to order prescription eyeglasses. If the measured PD is wrong, you will find the glasses uncomfortable and it will make you feel dizzy. Our patented PDCheck technology uses the smartphone camera to take a “selfie” and extracts the PD to an accuracy of +/- 1 mm. 

There are a lot of mobile apps out there that have you use a credit card or paper printout held against your forehead .… these simply do not work well due to many factors. PDCheck includes a special set of PD frames with patented T marks on the frames that provide an accurate reference point to determine the distance between the center of your eyes. The great thing about the PD frames is that by wearing them, your hands are free to get a great selfie. PDCheck works with both the front and rear facing cameras of your phone, so you can either measure your own PD or have someone else measure your PD by just taking a picture.

The PDCheck app uses image processing to detect the T marks and the pupils of your eyes; it will only work with these special frames. If you are not using the frames the PDCheck app will not give you a PD measurement. Once you take the selfie you can tweak the positions of the cursors a bit to make sure they are in the location that best matches the T’s and center of your eye.

Take a selfie and you'll get an automatic PD measurement

Adjust the markers to the center of your pupils and T marks (if needed) to get the most accurate PD.

For privacy reasons , the selfie image is not saved or uploaded anywhere. We just compute the relevant parameters needed for an accurate PD and upload those values, not the image, to the EyeQue Cloud®. The PD then becomes part of your EyeGlass Numbers and will display on your dashboard. Since your test results are uploaded into the secure EyeQue Cloud®, it allows you to access the data immediately, from both desktop and mobile. 

EyeQue membership:

Users of EyeQue’s products and services are members of the EyeQue Community; each with his/her own personal account. Each membership enables unlimited testing across ALL EyeQue products and includes personalized reporting.

To maintain and operate EyeQue’s infrastructure, EyeQue charges a nominal annual membership fee that allows users unlimited testing across all EyeQue devices as well as the storage of every EyeQue test result; this includes the development and release of new features. The current annual membership is only $4.99 per year, but this will likely increase in the future. 

Members use EyeQue’s web portal to view EGNs (EyeGlass Numbers), PD (Pupillary Distance), and other test results in a very meaningful way.  EyeQue provides members with a detailed report covering their vision results and vision history. Furthermore, EyeQue members are offered exclusive discounts and special promotions for purchasing EyeQue products and other related products through affiliated partnerships. 

All EyeQue device purchases come with a one-year membership for one user. Your membership will begin when you register your device on the EyeQue app (for any device).

EyeQue Bundle: Get all our products at a great price

Pledge the EyeQue bundle and get the full set of tests EyeQue offers. The Bundle includes the Vision Check Device, PDCheck, and the EyeQue Insight. The MSRP for the bundle is $148.99, but here you get it all for only $100. While Insight does not measure refraction, it accurately measures visual acuity, meaning it measures the sharpness of your vision using the standard visual acuity scale ranging from 20/20, which is considered normal vision, to 20/400, which is legally blind. In addition, Insight has contrast and color sensitivity tests built into the Insight app.  

EyeQue Insight:  

The EyeQue Insight is a professional-grade visual acuity screener. 

  • Binocular device beautifully designed to allow you to test with your eyeglasses on or off.
  • An adjustable PD wheel to ensure proper alignment for both eyes, for users of all ages.
  • Optics virtualize the smartphone screen so that it appears to be 20’ away as required for accuracy.
  • Screens vision ranging from 20/20 to 20/400 in under 3 minutes, providing exact measurements of single and dual eye performance.
  • Displays results in other scales including LogMar and 6/6
  • Uses a tumbling E which is excellent for young children that cannot read.
  • Tests your current glasses or contacts to determine if an updated prescription may be required.
  • Contains accurate color and contrast sensitivity tests.
  • Instantly records and securely stores results making data available to track and share with others to create a digital vision history.
  • One EyeQue Insight can be shared with many people, making it a value for families and suitable for testing large groups.
  • The Insight app has two modes: a straightforward "adult" mode, and a gamified "kids" mode for children
  • Expandable to support future vision tests developed by EyeQue.
  • Free download, the EyeQue Insight app in google play and apple store. Works on all Android and iPhones with a 4.7” screen and 300 PPI.

See what our users say about our 1st generation product, the Personal Vision Tracker. In a recent survey, 90% of those who've purchased glasses using their PVT-generated EyeGlass Numbers say they are the same or better than their previous prescription glasses. VisionCheck is a substantial improvement over our original product. 

Paul Gibson is an optometrist based in the U.K. 
 
These are real quotes from real customers. See MORE testimonials here!

1. Download the app for the EyeQue VisionCheck from either the Apple App or Google Play Store. First-time users will be required to register for an EyeQue account while current EyeQue user can log in and complete a short on-boarding procedure. During the process you’ll need to use the serial number to activate VisionCheck app.

2. Attach the device to your smartphone, logos facing down, buttons facing up. secure the device with the elastic band.  

3. Overlap the red and green lines by tapping the touch-sensitive "closer" and/or "farther" buttons on the device. Once you are satisfied that the lines are overlapped, tap the "next" button for your next set of lines. Continue this process for all 9 positions per eye.

4. In 3-5 minutes, you have your vision results! (The more tests you take, the better your results will be). Generate your EyeGlass Numbers by taking 3 or more vision tests. You can even email the results to yourself or your eye care provider.

5. Use the PDCheck to get your PD measurement in seconds. Put on our patented PD frames (included with your VisionCheck!) and take a picture of yourself; either in a selfie or with the help of others.

 6. Order glasses with your EyeGlass Numbers® at Zenni Optical

The EyeQue VisionCheck package contents include: 

  • VisionCheck device
  • Product manual (not shown)
  • Elastic safety band
  • Micro-USB charging cable
  • PDCheck frames (Pupillary distance measurement tool)

EyeQue has a family of vision testing products, each complementing another. 

Many factors were considered in the design of the VisionCheck. We set out to create another refraction device that was better optically, easier to use, and faster than the first-generation product but remained at a low-cost to the consumer.

Based on the feedback of our members, we came up with a device that had the following characteristics:

1.  A better optical system to allow the display lines to appear 50% larger than the lines in the previous device, making them easier to see therefore improving test efficiency and accuracy.

2.  Touch-sensitive test buttons on the VisionCheck device to improve the ergonomics of the test. Combined with the automated screen pattern and silt rotation, the VisionCheck allows you to take the test without ever taking your eyes off the device, so you can maintain focus and completing the test faster. 

3.  With a the device that no longer requires manual rotation, we fitted the VisionCheck with an eyecup with a more natural shape. The natural oval shape provides superior comfort and alignment.

4.  A device that is aesthetically pleasing; you can view some of the first sketches are shown below. The new housing needs to contain the electrical and mechanical elements of the device. 

EyeQue is on a mission to bring affordable eye care to everyone.

We’re putting accurate vision tests directly into the hands of people around the world.

Our patented technology makes self-administered eye tests available to billions of people– many of whom may not have had the ability to test their eyes and correct their vision without access to low cost, convenient solutions.

A Global Need to Raise Our EyeQue

It is estimated that more than sixty percent of the world’s population are vision impaired. Hundreds of millions of people, adults and children, are challenged daily by the discomfort and struggle of normal tasks like reading, studying, working and caring for their family. In fact, the global economic cost of lost work productivity due to people with poor vision has been estimated at 700 billion dollars per year.

Refractive error, which eyeglasses correct, is the number one cause of vision impairment in the world. Yet for many families in many countries, access to an optometrist is limited, if not non-existent, and the costs associated with obtaining corrective eyeglasses is not affordable and sometimes not even available. Our goal is to enable anyone, anywhere in the world to self-administer an accurate refractive measurement test. With our advancements in technology, the mobility of the testing platform, and the commitment to affordable vision solutions, EyeQue will empower people all over the world to easily access and inexpensively correct their vision and improve their daily lives.

Myopia (or nearsightedness) is the most common form of refractive error/distance vision impairment, and if uncorrected can lead to more serious vision problems including cataracts, glaucoma, retinal detachment, macular degeneration– all of which threatens sight. Yet this condition is easily corrected, and progression can be slowed with corrective glasses.

A closer look at this myopia epidemic: 

Uncorrected refractive error has been steadily climbing and is now the second most common cause for blindness (~20%), with the first being cataracts (~35%)).

We’re taking the growing myopia epidemic head-on by rapidly developing and distributing innovative at-home vision tests and devices.

Our Road is Long and Unpaved

We introduced the first at-home smartphone-powered refractometer in October 2016. Through continuous customer feedback loop – primed by our Kickstarter and Indiegogo backers! – we’re on schedule to deliver the second generation, powered refractometer in a few months. In between products, we released the EyeQue Insight which gives families and organizations a low-cost, super-fast way to measure visual acuity, color and contrast sensitivity. Our platforms are scalable to support additional software enhancements and new vision tests without replacing the hardware. We are currently developing technology to detect and monitor myopia in children as well as several other active projects which form a multi-year product roadmap.

Our sights are set on:

  • Empowering people to test their vision as often as they like, in the convenience of their home.
  • Arming the Optometry, Ophthalmology, and Optician industry with technological advancements for improved patient care; enabling remote patient monitoring for example, post-surgery.
  • Bringing  vision testing to areas of the world that otherwise lack standard eye care, people can correct their vision with eyeglasses.

EyeQue is also actively seeing non-governmental organizations (NGOs) to use our technology to expand their reach and enhance their services particularly in areas lacking eye care professionals.

We have a team of passionate and experienced optical, mechanical, electrical, software engineers and business professionals who worked tirelessly to develop the EyeQue VisionCheck, making it the most affordable and accurate product on the market today.


Important things to know: 
The EyeQue VisionCheck is a self-administered test and the quality of the results depend on how well the test is taken by the user. For certain people with various health conditions, the device will not give accurate results. We do not recommend the VisionCheck for anyone with known medical conditions associated with vision, such as cataracts, macular degeneration, glaucoma, keratoconus, and other possible eye conditions.

The instructions, videos, product manuals for VisionCheck are in English, and to use the device properly we recommend the user has a basic understanding of the English language and reviews the instructions before starting to test. 

The results of the device are not meant to replace prescriptions carried out by eye doctors. EyeQue recommends that users visit their eye care provider regularly for a full Eye Exam. 

VisionCheck is registered as a class 1 medical device (with 510K exemption) in the US with the Food and Drug Administration (FDA). We are currently pursuing but are NOT registered with any regulatory agencies outside the US, so the user uses this at their own risk. 

Eyeglass Numbers are not prescriptions and cannot be used in the US in place of a prescription to order eyeglasses from vendors that require proof of a prescription. It is up to the user to determine what to do with the information provided and EyeQue does not take any responsibility regarding how the results are used.

The VisionCheck device is a battery-powered device and should not be immersed in water or subjected other harsh environmental conditions.

 

UPDATE, 11/29/18: We are now in production! We've gathered some images of the molds used to produce the housing of the VisionCheck. We are extremely confident in the March delivery timeline!

1. Mold for the internal optics tube

2. Mold for the internal optics tube at a different angle

3. Mold for the housing (outside shell)

4. Mold for the packaging

 

Update 3/25/19:

WE ARE SHIPPING! Check out the boxes of VisionCheck we've received in our warehouse.

Individually packaged boxes of VisionCheck & Bundles going out to our backers!

Straight outta our shipping department:

story_txt:
WE ARE SHIPPING NOW! Scroll to the bottom of the campaign to see our inventory and packaging process! All backers will receive their rewards in June.At-home vision testing, powered by your smartphone. 
Check your eyes whenever, wherever
Measure your pupillary distance (PD) 
Order glasses online with your results 
Track your vision with personalized reports
EyeQue VisionCheck is a refractometer that measures your refractive error, i.e. your nearsightedness, farsightedness, and astigmatism. The tests show results in the same format as your prescription, allowing you to order glasses online. The results will also include your estimated near-vision add (NV ADD+), needed to purchase reading or progressive glasses.The VisionCheck includes a patent-pending pupillary distance (PD) measurement tool, called the PDCheck, that accurately captures your PD in a matter of seconds.  We've given over ONE THOUSAND demos of the VisionCheck over the course of 4 days. Check out what people are saying!

 
 EyeQue Provides Award-winning Consumer Technology The EyeQue VisionCheck's development is based on our first product, the EyeQue Personal Vision Tracker, a manual refractometer that launched on Kickstarter and Indiegogo in 2017. Having received over 4500 pledges, our technology was also nominated for the prestigious SPIE Prism award; referred to as the Oscars of the optical industry.Over the past two years, our patented technology has shown unprecedented accuracy and received praises from many of our users. Check out our testimonial section below!CES has honored us with not one, but TWO CES Innovations Awards in 2017 and 2019. Save money: The EyeQue VisionCheck is inexpensive (MSRP $59.99) compared to your typical office visit and can be shared with many persons. All of our products are supported through annual memberships, currently starting at $4.99 per year. Each membership enables unlimited usage of all EyeQue vision-testing products, ranging from $29.99 to $89.99. Save time: Unlike traditional office visits that you make once a year, you can use the EyeQue VisionCheck anywhere, anytime. All you need is a smartphone and an active internet connection. No need to schedule ahead, drive through traffic, and wait at the office only to sit through boring lectures or sales spiels. In comparison, each VisionCheck test takes about 5 minutes to complete once you understand the process. Most first-time users get great results after taking 3 or 4 tests, usually under 30 minutes in total. EyeQue is hassle free and gives back hours of your valuable time.More accurate than a single point-in-time refraction test: Since your vision fluctuates throughout the day, taking multiple tests at different times of the day gives a better average refraction than a one-time refraction test during an office visit. Especially if someone is having a bad day! The MIT-patented technology powering the VisionCheck has been extensively tested with over 12,000 users over the past 2 years and has been optimized to give excellent refraction values for ordering eyeglasses.    Real tests, real results: Unlike other online vision tests, VisionCheck gives you a true refraction measurement. These results are called "EyeGlass Numbers" (EGNs). We do not simply request and renew your prescription. EyeQue products ACTUALLY test your vision and generate real scientific results. Also, there's no wait time; you get refraction results (EGNs) immediately after you complete three refraction tests.  See your data, use your data: Your personalized dashboard can be accessed through your EyeQue account and contains a multitude of information about your vision. This includes detailed reports showing and explaining your results, as well as the consistency of your testing. The report even compares your vision results with the general EyeQue population! Use your most updated EyeGlass Numbers (EGNs) to order glasses online from trusted retailers or share them with your eye care provider.Safe & robust: VisionCheck uses only the illumination from your smartphone screen, filtering the light making it completely safe for your eyes. The VisionCheck device is rugged yet beautifully designed. Internal elements of the device are enclosed in a solid injection molded plastic housing while the precision optics are made from the highest grade polymers; the electronic components are commercially approved as well. VisionCheck has undergone extensive environmental testing including drop, temperature, humidity, and shock tests to ensure that it is safe and robust enough for household use. VisionCheck is registered with the FDA as well.                             Fun and easy to use: Simply launch the app, attach the VisionCheck device, and use the touch sensor buttons to perform a series of game-like actions to overlap the red and green lines as you look through the device. Voila, you get your refraction results in the form of EyeGlass Numbers, instantly. Voice guidance is also available, making it even easier to use. Seriously amazing support: Our success is based on your satisfaction, and we are committed to providing responsive solutions to meet your needs. Some of our members have described us as obsessively customer focused, a compliment that makes us smile. Typically, we respond to any email requests within 24 hours. We also have an online chat service to work through any issue you may be having. Our support staff are in-house professionals that work closely with our software and optical engineers. We also have an extensive database of educational content on vision and health, called "Knowledge Center", which can be accessed on our website anytime.We are mindful of your privacy and security. We use HIPAA compliant processes and cloud storage for all your EGNs and personal data. We do not share your information with any organizations for any purposes, EVER. What's inside?Below is an “exploded view” of the patented VisionCheck device. It is a precision optical instrument built with micron-level tolerances. Substantial engineering effort was required in order to build reliable devices on a mass scale. To achieve that, we have employed a team of exceptional industrial designers, mechanical, electrical, optical, and firmware engineers. How it works:The VisionCheck is based on an MIT patented technology licensed exclusively to EyeQue. This technology has been extensively tested in our 1st generation product, the Personal Vision Tracker and uses a variant of the inverse Shack-Hartmann effect. The device projects two parallel beams of light that comes from the smartphone display into your eyes and onto your retina. The beams of light come from red and green lines formed by illuminated pixels on your smartphone, separated by 2.5 mm when they leave the device so that they can fit through your pupil.Using an interactive touch-sensitive interface, the user overlaps the two lines to form what looks like one yellow line. Based on the amount of pixel movement made, EyeQue calculates the user's refractive error in that particular direction. The device then rotates the lines to another angle and you repeat the measurement. Measuring the refractive power over a number of different angles gives the sphere, cylinder, and axis needed to correct your vision with eyeglasses. The method works for most people who are willing and able to follow the instructions we provide.The science behind the device:We cannot explain the science without explaining the human eye first. Nearsightedness, farsightedness and astigmatism occur when the eye lens and eye distance are “out of synch". Normal distance vision is the result of the light entering the eye and focusing exactly on the retina, where the brain interprets sharp images. Common deviations from normal vision, nearsightedness, or myopia, occurs when the lens focuses the light before your retina; Farsightedness, or hyperopia, occurs when the lens focuses the light past your retina, both causing the brain to interpret "blurry" images. Almost 50% of the human population has some degree of nearsightedness, farsightedness, or astigmatism. These conditions are also known as "refractive errors".The EyeQue VisionCheck is an optical device that achieves the effect of a variable corrective lens as it translates pixel spacing on the smartphone screen to corrective powers. To simulate the effect of converging or diverging rays into your eye that a correction lens would provide, you simply move the pixels on the screen closer or further emulating the effect of a corrective lens; overlapping the red and green lines and creating a single yellow line. Think of the VisionCheck as a custom converter of pixel spacing to optical power. Using that conversion, VisionCheck can determine corrections from + 8 D to – 10 D.VisionCheck uses your smartphone's display to work; with a pixel spacing on the order of .07 mm (70 microns) or better– comparatively, about the diameter of a human hair. VisionCheck works well for phones down to 250 Pixels per inch (PPI). Any PPI below 250 means that the resolution is too low for it to be optometrically accurate.The iPhone6s, for example, has an adjacent pixel spacing of 21 microns, and about 63 microns between same color pixels. With this small pixel spacing, VisionCheck exceeds 0.25 Diopter resolution. As a reference,0.25 Diopter accuracy is the level typically achieved by Optometrists.While it is easy to understand how EyeQue can measure the overall optical power for nearsightedness and farsightedness, VisionCheck also gets an accurate measurement of astigmatism by sampling over different angels. To measure astigmatism, a complete set of power measurements is comprised of 9 measurements for your right eye and 9 measurements for your left eye. Measurements are made at increments of 40 degrees and with these measurements, the astigmatism is computed.Yes, that’s a lot of measurements but the device is making measurements of tiny differences that reflect the shape of the eye lens and cornea. About 1 diopter of astigmatism, a typical value implies that the non-spherical component of the eye is about 0.25 mm. 0.25mm is thinner than your average ball-point pen point.All computations are carried out in the EyeQue cloud as it takes a substantial amount of computation that is dependent on many different parameters including the smartphone you are using. As you take more tests, the results are aggregated together through averaging and removing bad data points. Each test is scored based on the goodness of the computed fit to the measurements. An example of test results is shown below.Along with your test results, we also provide you with a measure of the consistency. The plot on the right also shows how other users have performed as shown by the relative size of the blue dots; most but not all users fall into the "good" category. Our personalized vision report is a great way to stay in touch with your test results and vision changes.PDCheck:VisionCheck includes another cool test called PDCheck™. Accurate measurement of pupillary distance, PD, is necessary to order prescription eyeglasses. If the measured PD is wrong, you will find the glasses uncomfortable and it will make you feel dizzy. Our patented PDCheck technology uses the smartphone camera to take a “selfie” and extracts the PD to an accuracy of +/- 1 mm. There are a lot of mobile apps out there that have you use a credit card or paper printout held against your forehead .… these simply do not work well due to many factors. PDCheck includes a special set of PD frames with patented T marks on the frames that provide an accurate reference point to determine the distance between the center of your eyes. The great thing about the PD frames is that by wearing them, your hands are free to get a great selfie. PDCheck works with both the front and rear facing cameras of your phone, so you can either measure your own PD or have someone else measure your PD by just taking a picture.The PDCheck app uses image processing to detect the T marks and the pupils of your eyes; it will only work with these special frames. If you are not using the frames the PDCheck app will not give you a PD measurement. Once you take the selfie you can tweak the positions of the cursors a bit to make sure they are in the location that best matches the T’s and center of your eye.Take a selfie and you'll get an automatic PD measurementAdjust the markers to the center of your pupils and T marks (if needed) to get the most accurate PD.For privacy reasons , the selfie image is not saved or uploaded anywhere. We just compute the relevant parameters needed for an accurate PD and upload those values, not the image, to the EyeQue Cloud®. The PD then becomes part of your EyeGlass Numbers and will display on your dashboard. Since your test results are uploaded into the secure EyeQue Cloud®, it allows you to access the data immediately, from both desktop and mobile. EyeQue membership:Users of EyeQue’s products and services are members of the EyeQue Community; each with his/her own personal account. Each membership enables unlimited testing across ALL EyeQue products and includes personalized reporting.To maintain and operate EyeQue’s infrastructure, EyeQue charges a nominal annual membership fee that allows users unlimited testing across all EyeQue devices as well as the storage of every EyeQue test result; this includes the development and release of new features. The current annual membership is only $4.99 per year, but this will likely increase in the future. Members use EyeQue’s web portal to view EGNs (EyeGlass Numbers), PD (Pupillary Distance), and other test results in a very meaningful way.  EyeQue provides members with a detailed report covering their vision results and vision history. Furthermore, EyeQue members are offered exclusive discounts and special promotions for purchasing EyeQue products and other related products through affiliated partnerships. All EyeQue device purchases come with a one-year membership for one user. Your membership will begin when you register your device on the EyeQue app (for any device).EyeQue Bundle: Get all our products at a great pricePledge the EyeQue bundle and get the full set of tests EyeQue offers. The Bundle includes the Vision Check Device, PDCheck, and the EyeQue Insight. The MSRP for the bundle is $148.99, but here you get it all for only $100. While Insight does not measure refraction, it accurately measures visual acuity, meaning it measures the sharpness of your vision using the standard visual acuity scale ranging from 20/20, which is considered normal vision, to 20/400, which is legally blind. In addition, Insight has contrast and color sensitivity tests built into the Insight app.  EyeQue Insight:  The EyeQue Insight is a professional-grade visual acuity screener. 
Binocular device beautifully designed to allow you to test with your eyeglasses on or off.
An adjustable PD wheel to ensure proper alignment for both eyes, for users of all ages.
Optics virtualize the smartphone screen so that it appears to be 20’ away as required for accuracy.
Screens vision ranging from 20/20 to 20/400 in under 3 minutes, providing exact measurements of single and dual eye performance.
Displays results in other scales including LogMar and 6/6
Uses a tumbling E which is excellent for young children that cannot read.
Tests your current glasses or contacts to determine if an updated prescription may be required.
Contains accurate color and contrast sensitivity tests.
Instantly records and securely stores results making data available to track and share with others to create a digital vision history.
One EyeQue Insight can be shared with many people, making it a value for families and suitable for testing large groups.
The Insight app has two modes: a straightforward "adult" mode, and a gamified "kids" mode for children
Expandable to support future vision tests developed by EyeQue.
Free download, the EyeQue Insight app in google play and apple store. Works on all Android and iPhones with a 4.7” screen and 300 PPI.
See what our users say about our 1st generation product, the Personal Vision Tracker. In a recent survey, 90% of those who've purchased glasses using their PVT-generated EyeGlass Numbers say they are the same or better than their previous prescription glasses. VisionCheck is a substantial improvement over our original product. Paul Gibson is an optometrist based in the U.K.  These are real quotes from real customers. See MORE testimonials here!1. Download the app for the EyeQue VisionCheck from either the Apple App or Google Play Store. First-time users will be required to register for an EyeQue account while current EyeQue user can log in and complete a short on-boarding procedure. During the process you’ll need to use the serial number to activate VisionCheck app.2. Attach the device to your smartphone, logos facing down, buttons facing up. secure the device with the elastic band.  3. Overlap the red and green lines by tapping the touch-sensitive "closer" and/or "farther" buttons on the device. Once you are satisfied that the lines are overlapped, tap the "next" button for your next set of lines. Continue this process for all 9 positions per eye.4. In 3-5 minutes, you have your vision results! (The more tests you take, the better your results will be). Generate your EyeGlass Numbers by taking 3 or more vision tests. You can even email the results to yourself or your eye care provider.5. Use the PDCheck to get your PD measurement in seconds. Put on our patented PD frames (included with your VisionCheck!) and take a picture of yourself; either in a selfie or with the help of others. 6. Order glasses with your EyeGlass Numbers® at Zenni OpticalThe EyeQue VisionCheck package contents include: 
VisionCheck device
Product manual (not shown)
Elastic safety band
Micro-USB charging cable
PDCheck frames (Pupillary distance measurement tool)

story:
Every parent would do everything they can to protect their beloved children. However, time will come that they would need to let their kids fly on their own. The hardest part is the transition from being a protector to being a facilitator of the children’s learning and to be the one who see them put their wings to test. The most crucial part is letting go of the hands that parents would rather hold forever. MONCAR Simulators understands such situations very well. This is why MONCAR Simulators introduces its car simulation units. Teenagers can test their driving skills and develop it even better without putting their lives in danger. This is the best that parents can ever wish for.

MONCAR Simulators deviate from the conventional ways of training drivers-to-be. Instead of the usual lecture and actual driving in real roads, MONCAR Simulators’ car simulation units allow teenagers to drive in different road and weather conditions. With all the available technology, it’s about time to create and use one which will ensure your precious kids’ safety. Free reading materials are available so kids can learn more and develop their critical driving skills.

This technology features the National Driver Education Curriculum which comes highly recommended by The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA). This highly regarded national curriculum was developed with the professional association for traffic safety educators, American Driver and Traffic Safety Education Association or (ADTSEA) and it is also compatible with the Canadian Driving Standards.

Teenagers would love training using this technology as they will get to experience different scenarios that traditional driving lessons can never provide for them. They can drive through realistic simulations of different extreme situations such as snow, fog, dusk, rain, darkness, and a lot more. What parents would love about it is that their kids can develop their skills in driving through such unusual situations without actually exposing themselves to different accidents. It is a fun and exciting way to learn yet this method is even more effective than conventional driving lessons.

Parents and their teen-aged kids can enjoy this exceptional driving experience in an hour session, for a chance to practice two lessons each time.

MONCAR Simulators appeals for contributions in making this project a possibility. Contributions will help:

·  To educate both kids and parents about the importance of community safety and how this project can help in that matter.

·  To provide this innovative driving training which can turn kids into proficient drivers before they actually get behind the wheel.

·  To make the car simulation even more realistic through 3D movements, by paying the costs of developing a prototype and related researches.

Any amount of contribution can help MONCAR Simulators broaden their reach and lessen instances of vehicular accidents.

Sponsors can choose any of the contribution packages which range from $5-$65,000. The items that sponsors can get include “Thank you” and being mentioned in the official website, car sticker, t-shirt, car simulation sessions, full programs, and car simulators! The campaign’s goal is to raise $50,000.

MONCAR Simulators will appreciate any amount of contribution. Each sponsor package is not just monetary contribution because each time you help in this project, you save lives.

(NHTSA). This highly regarded national curriculum was developed with the
professional association for traffic safety educators, American Driver and
Traffic Safety Education Association or (ADTSEA) and it is also compatible with the Canadian Driving Standards.Teenagers would love training using this technology as they will get to
experience different scenarios that traditional driving lessons can never
provide for them. They can drive through realistic simulations of different
extreme situations such as snow, fog, dusk, rain, darkness, and a lot more.
What parents would love about it is that their kids can develop their skills in
driving through such unusual situations without actually exposing themselves to
different accidents. It is a fun and exciting way to learn yet this method is
even more effective than conventional driving lessons.Parents and their teen-aged kids can enjoy this exceptional driving
experience in an hour session, for a chance to practice two lessons each time.
MONCAR Simulators appeals for contributions in making this
project a possibility. Contributions will help:
· 
To educate both kids and parents about the importance of community
safety and how this project can help in that matter. 
· 
To provide this innovative driving training which can turn kids into proficient
drivers before they actually get behind the wheel. 
· 
To make the car simulation even more realistic through 3D movements, by
paying the costs of developing a prototype and related researches. 
Any amount of contribution can help MONCAR Simulators broaden
their reach and lessen instances of vehicular accidents.
Sponsors can choose any of the contribution packages which range from
$5-$65,000. The items that sponsors can get include “Thank you” and being
mentioned in the official website, car sticker, t-shirt, car simulation
sessions, full programs, and car simulators! The campaign’s goal is to raise
$50,000.
MONCAR Simulators will appreciate any amount of contribution.
Each sponsor package is not just monetary contribution because each time you
help in this project, you save lives.

story:
What temperature shall the milk / formula be?

BabyRing shows when the milk / formula temperature is right

Enjoy the cosy feeding-time knowing your milk is at a safe temperature by having the BabyRing band on the feeding bottle indicating when the temperature is too high by changing colour.

Use your baby´s best feeding bottle; the BabyRing band suits most glass bottles and plastic bottles and withstands dishwasher, microwave and sterilising.

You can also personalize your bottle by adding notes, such as name, allergies or date on one side of the band, with a pen. The notes can easily be wiped off or be made permanent by boiling the band in water.

Material and function tested by an authorised third party – free from BPA and other harmful substances, all for the benefit of your baby!

Which temperatur shall the milk or formula have? BabyRing band shows it for you! All for your baby’s safety!

it’s made of FDA approved silicone for your baby’s safety.

It’s BPA-free and free from phthalates – there is no harmful substances and it meets the standard for food containers

Tested by third part certification body

story:
Our Story

To ensure a healthy future generation, adolescents must be able to engage in open, honest and medically accurate discussions about sexual health with their heatlh care providers. Yet in reality, providers and teens don't always speak the same language.The Wisconsin Adolescent Health Care Communication Program (WAHCCP) is an intervention designed to bridge the communication gap between adolescents and their health care providers.


In it's first year, the WAHCCP Program has shown to be incredibly valuable to program participants and the demand for Teen Educators to facilitate workshops is high; however, funds for the program are low.  Help us make real impact on the quality of health care our young people receive by donating to this program today!


Our goal is to raise $1,000 help our Teen Educators reach youth and provider audiences throughout Wisconsin. This money is critical in reaching communities in need.  


Other Ways You Can Help

Share this link with your friends!  Follow us on Facebook and write kind notes to our Teen Educators to let them know how much they're needed and appreciated!

story:
On June 1, 2012, our beautiful sister was diagnosed with Stage III Invasive Lobular Carcinoma.  She found the cancer by random chance with a free mammogram through work.  Little did she know that her life would change completely after diagnosis.  This is when our family and friends launched "Ta Ta's 4 Tana" campaign to create fundraising efforts to support her through this journey.

The fact that she is only 36, and that this is not a typical form of breast cancer for her age, a mastectomy is set to take place next week and chemotherapy starts three weeks after surgery.  Aggressive and swift treatment is necessary to tackle this head on.

No matter what the situation, there is someone always worse off than yourself.  Tana is doing her best to keep the faith and instill her strength within her daughters while appreciating the fact that she is still fortunate to still have her life.  

Tana is a single mom and we (her family) are trying to do whatever we can to help her and her two daughters keep their home and alleviate medical bills through Tana's extensive treatments.

It is amazing what a difference $1, $5 or even more makes to a person trying to hold it together financially through this type of crisis.

MAY YOU BE BLESSED ABUNDANTLY AND FIND PLEASURES IN KNOWING THAT YOUR DONATION HELPED A FAMILY SURVIVE BREAST CANCER!!

Love & Blessings,

Ta Ta's 4 Tana

story:
Healthy and naturally white smile is a beauty trend of all times. But not everyone can afford it - lots of whiteners are ruining Your enamel and causing extra sensitivity, even if they are expansive. 

  So our main goal is to make Your teeth whiter without causing any side effects. 

 

              OUR PRODUCTS

  So here are our whitening stars: Fresh Mint Whitener, Juicy Lemon Whitener, Sweet Grep Whitener, Care Paste.

 

                                  WE ARE SPECIAL!
  You can say that Your ordinary whitening toothpaste also removes the plaque, but have You seen all those chemicals, aromas and sugar on the backside of Your toothpaste tube? Doesn't look very healthy, don't You think? 
  We use Organic Ingredients which will not only make Your teeth look whiter, but also will remineralize Your enamel, help to reduce bacteria and will keep Your teeth clean and fresh throughout the whole day! 
 
 In future we are planning to make a 3D mouth care which will include Whitening Paste, Care everyday paste, Care Mouth Wash and Organic Sugar Scrubs. And right now You can help us to bring this project to live!

 

 

OUR TEAM

When I say that Brush Me! is a family company I really mean that. My husband and my mother are helping me to built a strong and independent brand, and we will be very happy if You will become a part of our brand too!

story:
Short Summary

Hi there! My name is Mike "The Math Librarian" Martelle, a lifelong martial artist who will turn 40 this year. Before my birthday rolls around, I would LOVE to accomplish a goal that I've had since I was a child - to participate in a martial arts competition on every continent of the earth! Well, not counting Antarctica (I would, if anyone ever organized something there!).

To complete my quest, I need only to visit Africa! There are several competition options across the continent - lutte traditionelle, Sambo, and more. I'm currently working with various contacts to determine what would be best. Because many of these events occur on short notice, the goal of this campaign is to raise the funds necessary to get to an African event as soon a suitable one arises. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funds will be used to purchase airfare, accommodation, registration and expenses at the event. I also hope to volunteer for humanitarian work during my visit, and any additional funds will be donated in this fashion.
  • Grizzly Gym members can receive a variety of membership discounts in exchange for their donation, and corporate sponsors will receive advertisement (contact me for details).
Thank you so very much for your consideration!

story:
Our man Dean Laponsee was stricken with double pneumonia in the spring of 2013 which quickly turned into septic shock. Consequently, while fighting for his life he had to have both legs amputated. A couple of weeks later his left hand was amputated, and vision  in one eye was permanently lost. Dean's insurance company will not pay for having prosthetic limbs because they deemed the amputations not accidental but premeditated on behalf of the doctors.  Chronic illness only includes cancer, stroke and heart conditions.  Work insurance says illness did not result as of work. He wants to return to being productive. 

Dean served in our army, until he had kids, then went into fibre optics so he could be at home with his kids. He does not want to quit. His attitude is so positive yet he needs our help

If we can raise enough money for prosthetic legs and a hand,Dean  will continue to be part of our society and continue to contribute to our society. Do not let this man become a social welfare collector and a reflection of how we let him down. Don't turn your back on him like the insurance company.

Today is the day you reach out to help Dean Laponsee the way you would appreciate if the foot (pun intended) were in your shoes.. That choice is up to you.
